title: Republic Day Chief Guest Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto hails PM Modi's leadership, says it's an ‘inspiration’
summary: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto, the Chief Guest at India's 76th Republic Day, lauds PM Modi’s commitment to poverty alleviation and marginalized communities, calling it an ‘inspiration’.&nbsp;
full_content: India's Republic Day Chief Guest, Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto, hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership and said he had learned much from it. Subianto called PM Modi's commitment towards alleviating poverty and helping the marginalised “an inspiration”. Prabowo Subianto is on his first state visit to India as the Chief Guest of the 76th Republic Day. 75 years ago, in 1950, Indonesian President Sukarno was the Chief Guest of India's very first Republic Day. Also Read | Republic Day 2025 LIVE: Parade to begin at 10:30 am in Delhi, PM extends wishes At the special banquet, Subianto said, “I am very proud to be here (in India)...I am not a professional politician, I am not a good diplomat, I say what is in my heart. I came here for a few days but learned a lot from Prime Minister Modi 's leadership and commitments.” “His commitment to alleviating poverty, helping the marginalized, and helping the weakest part of your society, is an inspiration for us,” he added. Also Read | PM Modi wishes Indians on ‘75 glorious years of being a republic’ The Indonesian President also said he is proud to be in India and wishes “prosperity, peace, and greatness” for its people in the coming years. “I would like to wish the people of India prosperity, peace, and greatness in the coming years. I would like to see Indonesia and India continuing to be close partners and friends,” he said. President Prabowo was received by President Droupadi Murmu at the special banquet at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Saturday. She thanked President Subianto for accepting the invitation to grace India's Republic Day celebration as Chief Guest. Also Read | Republic Day 2025: A look at India’s chief guests in last 10 years “This is a reflection of the long-standing ties and strong democratic traditions between India and Indonesia,” Rashtrapati Bhavan said in a post on X, reminiscing on the 1950 Republic Day, which was graced by another Indonesian President. This year's ceremonial parade will also see the participation of a marching contingent and a band contingent from Indonesia. ( With ANI inputs )

title: Donald Trump pressures Jordan and Egypt to take Palestinians from Gaza, says 'it’s a real mess'
summary: Donald Trump urges Jordan and Egypt to accept Palestinians from Gaza, says 'it’s a real mess'
full_content: U.S. President Donald Trump remarked that Jordan and Egypt should accept more Palestinians from Gaza, where the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas has led to a humanitarian crisis. Donald Trump News Highlights While speaking about his call with Jordan's King Abdullah, the US President said, “I said to him I’d love you to take on more because I’m looking at the whole Gaza strip right now and it’s a mess, it’s a real mess. I’d like him to take people.” The President's statement came during a 20-minute question-and-answer session with reporters aboard Air Force One on Saturday as reported by Associated Press . Also Read | Donald Trump on WHO re-entry, says ’US would consider it,’ but... "I’d like Egypt to take people," Trump told reporters as quoted by several news agecny. He also informed reporters that he would be speaking to Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi today, January 26. “You're talking about, probably a million and a half people, and we just clean out that whole thing and say, You know it's, over,” he added. 'Almost everything's demolished, and people are dying' says Trump The President further told reporters, “But it's literally a demolition site right now. Almost everything's demolished, and people are dying there. So, I'd rather get involved with some of the Arab nations, and build housing in a different location, where they can maybe live in peace for a change.” Meanwhile, the truce for Gaza continued as Hamas released four female Israeli soldiers held captive during the 15-month-long war in Gaza in return for 200 Palestinian prisoners in Israel. The next exchange is expected on Feb. 1. The truce also halted the fighting in Gaza for at least six weeks. Also Read | Gaza ceasefire: Hamas names 4 female Israeli soldiers to be released on Saturday The war was sparked by Hamas' a ttack on Israel on Oct. 7, 2023 that killed around 1,200 people. The Israel-Hamas war has killed more than 47,000 people in Gaza, according to local health authorities, which don’t distinguish between combatants and civilians. (With inputs from agencies)

title: US' Marco Rubio says may place ‘very big bounty’ on Taliban top leaders, ‘bigger than one on Bin Laden’
summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he was hearing that the Taliban held more American hostages than previously reported.
full_content: The US may place a "very big bounty" on the top leaders of the Taliban, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Saturday, adding he was hearing that the Taliban held more American hostages than previously reported. "Just hearing the Taliban is holding more American hostages than has been reported," Rubio said in a post on social media platform X. The post did not give further details or specify the number of Americans held by the Taliban. Also Read | Taliban bans windows overlooking areas used by Afghan women Authorities in Kabul said in the past week that the United States freed an Afghan convicted by an American court on charges of drug smuggling and extremism in exchange for two U.S. citizens held in Afghanistan. Afghan officials said on Tuesday the man, Khan Mohammad, had landed in Kabul after being released. A spokesman for the Taliban administration confirmed that two Americans were released in the exchange. Also Read | The Taliban is removing every shred of freedom from women One of the Americans released was Ryan Corbett, according to a statement by his family. Corbett had been in Taliban detention since 2022, according to the family. U.S. media outlets said the other American released was named William McKenty. The Taliban took over Afghanistan in 2021 following a chaotic U.S. withdrawal from the country after 20 years of war. title: Republic Day 2025: PM Narendra Modi wishes Indians on ‘75 glorious years of being a republic’. What he said…
summary: Republic Day 2025: PM Modi marked 75 years of India being a republic. He expressed gratitude to those who contributed to the Constitution and emphasised the importance of democracy, dignity, and unity for a prosperous India.
full_content: Republic Day 2025: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished all Indians on the occasion of “75 glorious years of being a republic” in a post on social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter). PM Modi expressed gratitude to those who contributed to the Constitution and emphasised the importance of democracy, dignity, and unity for a prosperous India. Also Read | Republic Day 2025 LIVE: Parade to begin at 10:30 am in Delhi, PM extends wishes ‘Democracy, Dignity, Unity…’ “Today, we celebrate 75 glorious years of being a Republic. We bow to all the great women and men who made our Constitution and ensured that our journey is rooted in democracy, dignity and unity,” (sic) he wrote. “May this occasion strengthen our efforts towards preserving the ideals of our Constitution and working towards a stronger and prosperous India,” the prime minister added. Also Read | Republic Day Parade 2025: Timing and schedule; where to watch and more Republic Day 2025 Parade to Begin 10:30 am in Delhi Few hours are left for the beginning of grand Republic Day parade in the national capital, and spectators have already started arriving to witness the celebation at Kartavya Path. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto will be the Chief Guest — with military contingents from the country also participating in a march-past which will take place on Kartavya Path. The Republic Day parade will start at 10:30 am and continue for about 90 minutes. The ceremony will commence with the visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the National War Memorial, where he will lead the nation in paying solemn tributes to the fallen heroes by laying a wreath. The Prime Minister will then come to the saluting dais at Kartavya Path to witness the parade. Also Read | Happy Republic Day 2025 wishes: 50+ messages, images, WhatsApp status to share Republic Day Parade 2025: When and Where to Watch The main parade in New Delhi will commence at 10:30 AM on Sunday at Vijay Chowk, proceed along Kartavya Path, pass India Gate, and conclude at the Red Fort . The ceremony will conclude with a flypast by 47 aircraft, demonstrating India's aerial capabilities. The Republic Day celebrations will be widely broadcast and streamed online. Those tuning in from their TV sets can catch the live telecast of the parade on Doordarshan , the official broadcaster. Coverage begins at around 9:00 AM with the flag-hoisting ceremony by the President of India. Online viewers can livestream the event on Doordarshan National’s official YouTube channel. Prasar Bharati Live, the official government broadcast site, Disney+ Hotstar and other private news channels will also stream the event on their websites and apps.

title: Game Changer Box Office Collection Day 16: Ram Charan’s movie hangs on to Telugu, Hindi versions to survive week 3
summary: Despite a promising start, 'Game Changer' struggles to maintain its box office momentum, garnering only  ₹129.34 crore in 16 days. With controversies surrounding its earnings and tax evasion allegations against a key producer, the film's future hangs in the balance as it enters its third week.
full_content: Game Changer Box Office Collection Day 16 : Ram Charan and Kiara Advani's starrer Game Changer is clinging to its Telugu and Hindi versions to survive on the big screen for a third week. In 16 days, Game Changer has minted just ₹ 129.34 crore at the Indian Box Office. The political drama, once considered one of the first big releases of 2025, has witnessed a chiefly downward trend in its earnings after minting ₹ 51 crore on its opening day. Also Read | Game Changer OTT: When will Ram Charan’s movie start streaming online? Game Changer Box Office Collection on Day 16 Ram Charan 's movie, which relied solely on Telugu and Hindi to survive another week in theatres, earned a surprising ₹ 0.01 crore in Tamil on Saturday. On Day 16, according to Sacnilk, Game Changer earned ₹ 0.16 crore in Telugu and just ₹ 0.07 crore in Hindi. The film minted ₹ 0.24 crore on Saturday. Game Changer Box Office Collection Day 16 The film Game Changer netted ₹ 129.34 crore at the Indian box office in 16 days, while its gross collection stood at ₹ 153.92 crore. Of this, it has earned a total of ₹ 87.9 crore in its original language, Telugu, while in Hindi, the film earned ₹ 32.57 crore. The film also minted ₹ 8.27 crore in Tamil. It was also released in Malayalam and Kannada but could not breach even the ₹ 1 crore mark in either of the languages in 16 days. Also Read | Game Changer Box Office Day 9: Ram Charan’s film continues to struggle; mints… Game Changer Box Office Worldwide Collection Day 16 By Day 16, Game Changer had earned just ₹ 184.17 crore globally, which is still far from what the makers had claimed it earned on its opening day. The makers of Game Changer had announced that the film had collected ₹ 186 crore on its opening day, January 10. According to industry tracker Sacnilk, the political drama has minted ₹ 30.25 crore overseas. Game Changer Controversy With a decreasing trend in its collections, the film is also marred by controversy over inflated worldwide collections and IT raids linked to prominent Telugu film producer and Telangana Film Development Corporation chairman Dil Raju. On January 14, Bollywood veteran Ram Gopal Varma publicly criticised the reported Game Changer box office collection starring Ram Charan. In a series of tweets, he raised doubts about the credibility of the numbers shared by the film’s producers. RGV called them exaggerated and misleading. Also Read | Pushpa 2 director Dil Raju facing raids by Income Tax over tax evasion claims Then, on January 21, the Income Tax department conducted searches at multiple locations linked to prominent Telugu film producer and Telangana Film Development Corporation chairman Dil Raju, as well as others, official sources said, as reported by PTI. The searches were reportedly conducted in connection with allegations of tax evasion and covered multiple locations, including properties in Jubilee Hills and Banjara Hills, sources stated as reported by PTI.

title: Hoax bomb threats to Chennai-bound flight and Jammu Republic Day event attended by Omar Abdullah on January 26
summary: A hoax bomb threat to Chennai-bound flight ahead of Republic Day celebrations.
full_content: A hoax bomb threat was issued to Chennai-bound flights ahead of Republic Day celebrations, reported PTI on Sunday. The flight was carrying 85 passengers from Kochi. After thorough checking upon landing, no explosives were found. The hoax bomb threat was made over a phone call. A similar bomb threat was issued at the main Republic Day celebration venue in Jammu and Kashmir, reported PTI. The event was scheduled to be attended by Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha, who will unfurl the flag. The hoax bomb threat was sent from a username “Dise Lish” to the official mail accounts of various departments, including the secretary of higher education and director of higher education, on Saturday night, the report added. Recent hoax bomb threat On January 14, an IndiGo flight from Goa to Mumbai received a bomb threat that turned out to be a hoax after security checks. Indigo flight 6E 5101 was taken to an isolation bay, and all the passengers were evacuated after landing in Mumbai, reported PTI. Also Read | Agra: Taj Mahal gets bomb threat! Police says, ‘received email that said…’ "All standard operating procedures were followed and the aircraft was positioned back to the terminal post clearance from relevant authorities," an Indigo spokesperson told PTI. However, the number of passengers on the Mumbai-bound flight is not known yet. A hoax bomb threat was issued in a note onboard the plane. Due to the hoax threat, an emergency was declared at Mumbai airport for nearly an hour from 10:30 pm to 11:30 pm. Also Read | Man sends hoax bomb threats to PMO, and flights for THIS reason Issue of bomb threats From August 2022 to November 13, nearly 1,143 hoax bomb threats were made to domestic airlines between August 2022 and November 13. Out of this number, 994 hoax bomb threats were made this year, according to government data. “As many as 27 hoax bomb threat calls were received between August and December 2022. The number increased to 122 in 2023, while the current year alone witnessed a sharp rise, with 994 calls reported as of mid-November 2024," MP Kartikeya Sharma, the minister of state (MoS) for civil aviation Murlidhar Mohol told in the Parliament. Also Read | CRPF schools in Delhi, Hyderabad, other cities receive hoax bomb threat “The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security, aviation security regulator in the country, has mandated robust protocols for handling such threats. Bomb threat contingency plan (BTCP), a detailed contingency plan, is in place to handle such threats. As a part of BTCP, every airport has a designated Bomb Threat Assessment Committee (BTAC) which analyses the threat and acts accordingly”, he added.

title: Donald Trump to rejoin WHO after signing withdrawal order? US President says, ‘maybe we would…’
summary: US President Donald Trump recently ordered a US exit due to dissatisfaction with WHO handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and other health crises.
full_content: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday that he may consider rejoining the World Health Organization. This comes just days after ordering a US exit from the global health agency over what he described as a mishandling of the COVID-19 pandemic and other international health crises. Donald Trump News While speaking at rally in Las Vegas, he said, “Maybe we would consider doing it again, I don't know. Maybe we would. They would have to clean it up." The U.S. is scheduled to leave the WHO on January 22, 2026. Trump announced the move on Monday after he was sworn in for a second term in the White House. Being the top WHO donor, the US contributed about $130 million per year to help cover its global health preparedness and response, along with efforts to address HIV, tuberculosis, and childhood vaccination, according to US media reports. Also Read | Donald Trump hits out at US Fed chair Powell: ’I know interest rates better’ A potential US exit could significantly impact its funding. In the 2024-25 budget cycle, US contributions amounted to $662 million, or 19% of the organization's total revenue, according to the WHO. While speaking to the Las Vegas crowd, Trump expressed his frustration as the U.S contributed more to the WHO than China, despite China having a much larger population. Also Read | Donald Trump bans CBDC in US: What it means? ‘Hope United States will reconsider’, says WHO Taking to X, the organisation wrote , “The World Health Organization regrets the announcement that the United States of America intends to withdraw from the Organization…We hope the United States will reconsider and we look forward to engaging in constructive dialogue to maintain the partnership between the USA and WHO, for the benefit of the health and well-being of millions of people around the globe.” What are the other executive orders signed by the US President? President Donald Trump issued a flurry of executive orders and directives as he sought to put his stamp on his new US administration soon after taking oath of office on Monday, January 20. The multiple executive orders, signed by US President Donald Trump on 1st day, were associated with Paris Agreement, World Health organisation, crackdown on immigration, Declassification of historic documents etc. Also Read | Trump’s birthright citizenship order: What awaits children of H1-B visa holders? Additionally, Trump removed security protection for former COVID-19 advisor Anthony Fauci , prohibited the development of a Central Bank Digital Currency ( CBDC ), directed the release of the final assassination files related to Robert F. Kennedy and Martin Luther King Jr., dismissed 17 independent inspectors, raised concerns about FEMA’s future, reinstated anti-abortion agreements, and took several other actions. (With inputs from Reuters)

title: US lawmaker introduces ‘Contraception Begins at Erection Act’, seeking to ban masturbation, casual sex
summary: US lawmaker introduces 'Contraception Begins at Erection Act', seeking to ban masturbation, casual sex
full_content: Mississippi state Senator Bradford Blackmon, a Democrat, introduced a bill this week that seeks to ban men from masturbating or engaging in other sexual acts when they have no "intent to fertilize an embryo." According to NBC news, the bill is unlikely to pass the GOP-led Legislature, but if it does and is signed into law by Gov. Tate Reeves, a Republican, it would go into effect in July. Also Read | China to send Monkey to its space station for testing reproduction in space Here's what the Bill, which is unlikely to be passed in the House, stated: The "Act" seeks to "provide that it shall be unlawful for a person to discharge genetic material [or sperm] without the intent to fertilize an embryo; to provide for criminal penalties; to provide certain exceptions; and for related purposes." Exceptions The two exceptions mentioned in the Bill said the law shall not apply to the discharge of “genetic material”: (a) Donated or sold to a facility for the purpose of future procedures to fertilize an embryo ( sperm donation ). (b) Discharged with the use of a contraceptive or contraceptive method intended to prevent fertilization of an embryo ( unprotected sex ). Also Read | Abortion pill demand surged to astonishing levels on Trump’s victory day Punishments: Upon conviction of a violation of this section, a person shall be fined: (a) $1000.00 for a first offense; (b) $5000.00 for a second offense; and (c) 10,000.00 for a third or subsequent offense Also Read | Nigeria rights body finds ’no evidence’ military conducted secret mass abortions Why was this bill introduced? In a statement to NBC affiliate WLBT of Jackson, Blackmon referred to the high number of state legislative bills introduced in recent years that target women's access to reproductive health care , specifically abortion and contraception. "All across the country, especially here in Mississippi, the vast majority of bills relating to contraception and/or abortion focus on the woman’s role when men are fifty percent of the equation," he wrote. "This bill highlights that fact and brings the man’s role into the conversation. People can get up in arms and call it absurd but I can’t say that bothers me." Currently, 12 states, including Mississippi, have total or near-total abortion bans, while an additional six states ban abortion from six to 12 weeks of gestation, according to NBC report citing KFF, a nonprofit group that researches health policy issues.

summary: Sky Force collected  ₹21.5 crore on its second day, marking a 75.51% jump in earnings. Discounted ticket prices contributed to its success, but the film's future depends on audience response during weekdays.
full_content: Sky Force Box Office Collection Day 2 : Akshay Kumar's aerial action thriller saw a massive 75 per cent jump in earnings on Saturday after a decent opening-day collection. According to industry tracker Sacnilk, Sky Force owes this uptick in earnings to the big discount the makers are offering on online ticket bookings. Also Read | Sky Force BO Collection Day 1: Will Veer Pahariya be Akshay Kumar’s lucky charm? Sky Force Box Office Collection Day 2 Akshay Kumar-Veer Pahariya's film saw a massive 75.51% uptick in earnings on its second day in theatres. According to Sacnilk data, the film earned ₹ 21.5 crore on Saturday. With this, the film has minted a total of ₹ 33.75 crore in two days. Sacnilk said earnings are expected to jump further on Sunday, Republic Day. The industry tracker has estimated that the film will earn around ₹ 60 crore net on its opening weekend. Also Read | Sky Force hit or another flop? Akshay Kumar’s movie’s advance booking for Day 1 Heavily discounted tickets The industry tracker said Sky Force might not have been able to collect this much money with regular ticket prices from the opening day. However, it highlighted that having heavily discounted ticket prices is not a good long-term plan, even if it has worked in favour of movies to bring the audience in large numbers and spread word of mouth. The movie's second-day collection indicates that it has managed to draw moviegoers' attention, but its real test will begin on Monday. A good hold during working days, possibly with positive word of mouth, will put the movie in the best position to score a success, Sacnilk said. Sky Force Box Office Collection Day 1 Veer Pahariya has been a lucky charm for Akshay Kumar , who is marking his best movie premiere in years with Sky Force. After years of box office flops for Akshay, this aerial action thriller opened to double-digit collections. His last hit movie was Rohit Shetty’s Sooryavanshi in 2021. Sky Force minted ₹ 11.25 crore (net) on its opening day, January 24. Sky Force marks the debut of Veer Pahariya . Directed by Abhishek Anil Kapur and Sandeep Kewlani, the movie also stars Nimrat Kaur and Sara Ali Khan in lead roles. Sky Force Budget According to media reports, Sky Force was made with a low budget of ₹ 160 crore.

title: Google Doodle celebrates India's 76th Republic Day with wildlife-themed illustration. Here's what it represents
summary: Google Doodle celebrates India's 76th Republic Day with wildlife-themed illustration. Here's what it represents
full_content: Google celebrated India's 76th Republic Day with a special doodle that represented the country's rich diversity and national pride. The colourful wildlife-themed illustration, created by Pune-based artist Rohan Dahotre, features a number of animals representing various regions of India, woven into the letters of 'GOOGLE' to resemble a lively 'wildlife parade'. Among the highlights are a peacock in flight, a crocodile, a snow leopard dressed in traditional Ladakhi attire, a tiger sporting a dhoti-kurta while playing a musical instrument, and an antelope carrying a ceremonial staff. What this Google Doodle represents? Rohan Dahotre, a wildlife illustrator who created the illustration, said his "initial thoughts centered around showcasing the unity of people from diverse cultures coming together to celebrate." "My goal was to create a doodle that was not only colorful but also inclusive, representing a wide spectrum of Indians to ensure it resonated with everyone. As a wildlife illustrator, I also considered incorporating animals dressed in traditional human attire, an idea that was met with enthusiasm," he said. Rohan Dahotre, said he is a always inspired by India's rich and diverse culture. "Often described as a land of 'unity in diversity,' India beautifully reflects this spirit through its people coming together from various cultural backgrounds," he said. "My illustration also draws inspiration from the diverse wildlife of my nation. India boasts incredible biodiversity, from the cold, snowy regions of the Himalayas in the north to the lush rainforests of the Western Ghats in the south, where new species are still being discovered at this moment," Dahotre said. He added, "The country's varied habitats include deserts, wetlands, grasslands, lakes, and seas, each home to unique flora and fauna. My aim was not only to highlight India's regions, cultures, and geographical richness." What message this Google Doodle convey? Dahotre said the first message is about maintaining unity in diversity. "This is the essence of what Republic Day teaches us - how people from different cultures come together as one for the nation. I believe this principle should extend beyond India to the entire world. The 21st century should not stand for war but for acceptance and peace. Together, all nations can embrace their differences and unite for the betterment of humanity," he said. The second message, he said, focuses on the preservation of nature and ecology. "I hope this artwork inspires awareness of the incredible wildlife that exists in our country. India is truly gifted, and preserving this natural wealth is crucial. This planet does not belong to humans alone, and climate change is a pressing reality. Let us remain conscious of our environment and the extraordinary species with whom we share this planet," he added.

title: India Celebrates 76th Republic Day: Parade Showcases Military Might, Cultural Heritage | Watch LIVE
summary: President Droupadi Murmu unfurled the Tricolour on the occasion of 76th Republic Day celebrations. The Indian Armed Forces marched on the iconic Kartavya Path, showcasing India's military might.
full_content: India Celebrates 76th Republic Day: Parade Showcases Military Might, Cultural Heritage | Watch LIVE Curated By : Ashesh Mallick News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 11:27 IST President Droupadi Murmu unfurled the Tricolour on the occasion of 76th Republic Day celebrations. The Indian Armed Forces marched on the iconic Kartavya Path, showcasing India's military might. reset Follow us on Google News Republic Day 2025 (PTI Image) The iconic Kartavya Path hosted a grand parade on Sunday as India celebrates its 76th Republic Day , showcasing the military might and unity of the country. The contingents from the Indian Armed Forces and Paramilitary Forces marched down the Kartavya Path near India Gate and National War Memorial. A total of 18 marching units, 15 bands, and 31 tableaux are on display. related stories Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid a wreath at the National War Memorial ahead of the commencement of the celebrations. President Droupadi Murmu unfurled the national flag at Kartavya Path after which the parade began. The parade began with the National Salute and will go on for 90 minutes. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto is the chief guest for the occasion. Republic Day 2025 Celebrations A marching contingent and a band contingent from Indonesia also took part in the parade. The celebrations began with the arrival of President Murmu and her Indonesian counterpart in the ‘traditional buggy’, the practice which started being followed again in 2024 after a 40-year gap. This year’s celebrations focus on the 75 years of the enforcement of the Constitution. The theme for the tableaux is ‘Swarnim Bharat: Virasat aur Vikas’. Two Param Vir Chakra awardees — Subedar Major & Honorary Captain Yogendra Singh Yadav (retd) and Subedar Major Sanjay Kumar (retd) — both of who fought in the Kargil war — and Ashok Chakra awardee Lt Col Jas Ram Singh (retd) led the marching contingents and offered a salute to the President. As many as 16 tableaux from various states and Union Territories and 15 from union ministries, departments and organisations showcased India’s cultural unity in diversity. In this year’s parade, 5,000 artists performed more than 45 dance forms from various parts of the country in an 11-minute cultural performance titled ‘Jayati Jaya Mama Bharatam’. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Some of the cutting-edge defence platforms including BrahMos, Pinaka, and Akash, with the Army’s Battle Surveillance System ‘Sanjay’ and DRDO’s surface-to-surface tactical missile ‘Pralay’ marked their presence in the ceremonial parade for the first time. The parade also featured T-90 ‘Bhishma’ tanks, Sarath (the BMP-II infantry combat vehicle), the 10-meter Short Span Bridging System, the Nag Missile System, as well as the multi-barrel rocket launcher system ‘Agnibaan’ and the ‘Bajrang’ light specialist vehicle. tags : republic day republic day 2025 Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 10:27 IST News india India Celebrates 76th Republic Day: Parade Showcases Military Might, Cultural Heritage | Watch LIVE Read More

title: Bomb Threat At Jammu's Republic Day Venue Turns Out To Be Hoax
summary: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha is scheduled to unfurl the national flag and take salute at the march past at the M A Stadium, the venue for the main Republic Day function in the Union Territory.
full_content: Bomb Threat At Jammu's Republic Day Venue Turns Out To Be Hoax Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:54 IST Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha is scheduled to unfurl the national flag and take salute at the march past at the M A Stadium, the venue for the main Republic Day function in the Union Territory. reset Follow us on Google News They said a special team was also constituted to identify and arrest the culprits who have sent the e-mail. (File) A bomb threat prompted a thorough search at the main Republic Day venue here in Jammu and Kashmir, hours before the start of the function, officials said on Sunday. However, the threat received through e-mail late Saturday, proved to be a hoax, the officials said. related stories Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha is scheduled to unfurl the national flag and take salute at the march past at the M A Stadium, the venue for the main Republic Day function in the Union Territory. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah is also attending the function as the chief guest. The officials said the threat e-mail was sent from a username “Dise Lish" to the official mail accounts of various departments including secretary higher education and director higher education on Saturday night. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The e-mail prompted deployment of multiple teams of bomb disposal squad at the stadium which was thoroughly searched in presence of senior police officers throughout the night, the officials said, adding nothing incriminating was found during the searches. They said a special team was also constituted to identify and arrest the culprits who have sent the e-mail. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : bomb hoax jammu and kashmir manoj sinha republic day Location : Jammu, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 09:53 IST News india Bomb Threat At Jammu's Republic Day Venue Turns Out To Be Hoax Read More

title: American Singer Mary Millben Extends Greetings On Republic Day, Sings Indian National Anthem To Wish Indians | Watch
summary: Mary Millben is the singer who performed the Indian national anthem at the Ronald Reagan Building in Washington DC in 2023.
full_content: American Singer Mary Millben Extends Greetings On Republic Day, Sings Indian National Anthem To Wish Indians | Watch Curated By : Shobhit Gupta News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:38 IST Mary Millben is the singer who performed the Indian national anthem at the Ronald Reagan Building in Washington DC in 2023. reset Follow us on Google News International singer Mary Millben. (File) Renowned African-American actress and singer Mary Millben on Sunday greeted India and the fellow citizens on the occasion of the country’s 76th Republic Day and joined the virtual global celebration by singing National Anthem. “To His Excellency @narendramodi, Her Excellency @rashtrapatibhvn, the Indian Allied Forces, my beloved India, and Indian communities across the world, Happy 76th Republic Day! Let’s sing together!" she said. related stories To His Excellency @narendramodi , Her Excellency @rashtrapatibhvn , the Indian Allied Forces, my beloved India, and Indian communities across the world, Happy 76th Republic Day!Let’s sing together! 🇺🇸🇮🇳 #RepublicDay #India #PMModi @PMOIndia @mygovindia @BJP4India @iccr_hq pic.twitter.com/sVEpoSrrCU — Mary Millben (@MaryMillben) January 25, 2025 Millben has been a supporter and well-wisher of India and has been lauding PM Modi’s efforts to bring peace as a world leader. She is the singer who performed the Indian national anthem at the Ronald Reagan Building in Washington DC in 2023. Following her performance, she touched the feet of PM Modi to seek his blessings, attracting huge media attention. Millben previously performed at the 2020 Diwali celebrations where she performed Om Jai Jagdish Hare. A former White House Presidential Appointee to George W Bush, Millben has performed for world leaders and three US presidents – Barack Obama and Donald Trump. The singer has used her music as a tool to promote peace and friendship globally. India’s 76th Republic Day Celebrations As the nation comes together to celebrate the pride and spirit of Republic Day today (January 26), Kartavya Path in the heart of the capital will host a grand parade showcasing India’s strength and unity. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The parade will feature contingents from the Indian Armed Forces and paramilitary forces, with a total of 18 marching units, 15 bands, and 31 tableaux on display. It will begin at 10:30 am. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto will be the chief guest for the occasion. At least 10,000 special guests have been invited from across the country and a total of 7,70,000 passes and tickets have been issued. tags : India Mary Millben republic day Location : New York, United States of America (USA) First Published: January 26, 2025, 09:33 IST News india American Singer Mary Millben Extends Greetings On Republic Day, Sings Indian National Anthem To Wish Indians | Watch Read More

title: UP Advocate Pleading Sister's Divorce Kidnapped, Crushed To Death; Estranged Brother-In-Law Held
summary: By the time the police got information about the kidnapping, the accused brutally thrashed Yadav and threw him on the road in the Walterganj area.
full_content: UP Advocate Pleading Sister's Divorce Kidnapped, Crushed To Death; Estranged Brother-In-Law Held Curated By : Shobhit Gupta News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:05 IST By the time the police got information about the kidnapping, the accused brutally thrashed Yadav and threw him on the road in the Walterganj area. reset Follow us on Google News The advocate was pleading for his sister in her divorce case, police said. (Pixabay/representative) In a shocking incident, a 50-year-old advocate was allegedly kidnapped, beaten up and then crushed to death under a vehicle in Uttar Pradesh’s Basti district The police have arrested his estranged brother-in-law in connection with the case. related stories The 50-year-old advocate, Chandrashekhar Yadav, a resident of Baidolia Ajaib in Kaptanganj police station area, had gone to attend a ‘Thana Samadhan Diwas’ event on Saturday when some miscreants, driving a Scorpio, kidnapped him while returning home on a bike, reported news agency PTI as quoted by the police. By the time the police got information about the kidnapping, the accused brutally thrashed Yadav and threw him on the road in the Walterganj area. The accused then ran over him with their vehicle and fled, a senior police official said. Basti Superintendent of Police (SP) Abhinandan said the advocate’s sister and her husband Ranjeet Yadav were going through a divorce and he was pleading the case. The police suspect the crime to have been committed in connection with the same. There was a dispute over the financial aspect of the divorce settlement due to which Ranjit and his brother Sandeep kidnapped the advocate and killed him, the SP told the news agency. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Ranjit Yadav, the main accused in the case has been arrested and police teams have been deployed to arrest the other accused, the officer added. Upon getting information about the incident, a large number of advocates reached the hospital and demanded the arrest of the killers. tags : Basti uttar pradesh police Location : Basti, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 09:05 IST News india UP Advocate Pleading Sister's Divorce Kidnapped, Crushed To Death; Estranged Brother-In-Law Held Read More

title: Happy Republic Day 2025: Heartfelt Wishes, Images, Quotes, Messages And WhatsApp Status To Share
summary: Republic Day 2025: India marks its 76th Republic Day this year on January 26. Here are some heartfelt wishes, messages, greetings, patriotic quotes and images to share with your family, friends, colleagues and boss to invoke a feeling of gratitude for our nation.
full_content: Happy Republic Day 2025: Heartfelt Wishes, Images, Quotes, Messages And WhatsApp Status To Share Published By : Nibandh Vinod Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:00 IST Republic Day 2025: India marks its 76th Republic Day this year on January 26. Here are some heartfelt wishes, messages, greetings, patriotic quotes and images to share with your family, friends, colleagues and boss to invoke a feeling of gratitude for our nation. reset Follow us on Google News Happy Republic Day 2025: Wishes, images, messages, quotes and photos to share with your loved ones on Gantantra Diwas. (Image: Shutterstock) HAPPY REPUBLIC DAY 2025 WISHES, QUOTES, STATUS, MESSAGES: India is celebrating its 76th Republic Day today on January 26, 2025, with great pomp and show across the country. It day marks the anniversary of the formal adoption of the Constitution of India on January 26, 1950, making the country a democratic republic. On this occasion, India stands poised as the tricolour unfurls and the national anthem plays to celebrate the achievements of our nation and pay tribute to the sacrifices of our freedom fighters who made this possible. ALSO READ: Happy Republic Day Wishes 2025: Quotes, Messages And WhatsApp Status to Share related stories The main highlight of this day is the grand parade at Kartavya Path in New Delhi which every citizen excitedly awaits. This parade showcases the cultural and military diversity of India, as various states and union territories take part, displaying their folk dances, tableaux and music. (Image: Network18 Creative) As the day is ahead, make it more prideful by delving into some of the best and most inspirational Republic Day quotes, from different leaders, thinkers, and patriots. Read below to explore the wishes, quotes, and messages in English that capture the essence of the Indian Republic. Let us celebrate the spirit of India—a land of diverse cultures, traditions, and languages. United we stand, proud and strong. Jai Hind! Happy Republic Day Wishes In Marathi: Happy Republic Day to every Indian! Let’s honour the sacrifices made for our nation’s independence and work towards a brighter future. (Image: Shutterstock) May the vibrant hues of freedom paint your day, and the spirit of unity weave joy in every way. Happy Republic Day 2025! On this Republic Day, let us salute the brave souls who laid down their lives for our freedom and dignity. Let us pay homage to the architects of our Constitution who gave us the rights and duties of citizenship. Happy Republic Day 2025! Republic Day Wishes 2025: On this Republic Day, let’s remember the heroes who gave us the gift of freedom. Wishing you peace, prosperity, and pride in our great nation. (Image: Shutterstock) As we hoist the tricolour high, let’s fill our hearts with pride and strive to build a nation that forever thrives. Happy Republic Day 2025 to all my fellow Indians! Wishing you a very Happy Republic Day 2025. May this day bring happiness to all the countrymen. Happy Republic Day 2025 Wishes: Warm wishes on Republic Day! May we continue to cherish the principles of justice, liberty, and equality that form the foundation of our democracy. (Image: Shutterstock) Let the tricolour flutter high, echoing our freedom’s cry! I wish you a Happy Republic Day 2025, filled with unity, pride, and progress. May the torch of freedom shine ever bright as we march towards a future, bold and full of light. Happy Republic Day 2025! Republic Day Greetings! May this day remind us of the progress we’ve made and the journey ahead towards a more inclusive and prosperous India. Happy Republic Day 2025 to you and your loved ones. title: Republic Day 2025: Kerala Lottery Akshaya AK-687 Draw for 26 January Postponed
summary: The Kerala Lottery Department has announced that the regular lucky draw scheduled for January 26 will not take place. Consequently, the highly anticipated Akshaya AK-687 draw has been postponed.
full_content: Republic Day 2025: Kerala Lottery Akshaya AK-687 Draw for 26 January Postponed Published By : News Desk Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:00 IST The Kerala Lottery Department has announced that the regular lucky draw scheduled for January 26 will not take place. Consequently, the highly anticipated Akshaya AK-687 draw has been postponed. reset Follow us on Google News Kerala Lottery lucky draw for 26 January, 2025 have been postponed. (Image: Shutterstock) In observance of India’s 76th Republic Day , the Kerala Lottery Department has announced that there will be no regular lucky draw on January 26. As a result, the much-awaited draw for Akshaya AK-687 will be postponed. The next draw will be held on Monday, January 27 for the Win Win W-806 lottery. The winner of the first prize will get Rs 75 lakh. Make sure to check this space tomorrow for your chance to win big! WIN WIN W- 806 LOTTERY: PRIZE STRUCTURE related stories 1st Prize: Rs 75 Lakh 2nd Prize: Rs. 5 Lakh 3rd Prize: Rs. 1 Lakh 4th Prize: Rs. 5,000 5th Prize: Rs. 2,000 6th Prize: Rs. 1,000 7th Prize: Rs. 500 Consolation Prize: Rs. 8,000 HOW TO VERIFY LOTTERY RESULTS? To confirm the lottery results and winning numbers, go to the official website at www.keralalottery.info . The Kerala Government Gazette Office also has access to the results. HOW TO COLLECT YOUR PRIZE MONEY? To find out if you won, compare the numbers on your ticket with those in the Kerala Government Gazette. You can get your prize if the number on your ticket matches one of the winning numbers that were revealed. Within 30 days following the draw, winners must come to the Kerala Lottery offices in Thiruvananthapuram to pick up their prize. To verify and pick up your prize, make sure you have the winning ticket and proper identification with you. DOCUMENTS REQUIRED TO CLAIM PRIZE MONEY? It is necessary to have a self-attested photocopy of the winning ticket that is signed on both sides. Two passport-sized photos that have been approved and signed by a Gazette official must be submitted. A second copy of the participant’s PAN card should be provided. Fill out the prize claim form online, including a revenue stamp, and send it in. Show legitimate identity, such as a voter ID, PAN card, ration card, Aadhaar, or a comparable document. HOW TO DOWNLOAD A PDF WITH A FULL LIST OF WINNING NUMBERS? Go to keralalotteries.info or keralalotteryresult.net, the official website for the Kerala Lottery. To check the lottery result click the link. The screen will show up the winning numbers. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all On the website, look for the download option. To view the full lottery results, download the PDF file. tags : kerala lottery kerala lottery result kerala lottery result 2025 kerala lottery result today Location : Thiruvananthapuram [Trivandrum], India First Published: January 26, 2025, 09:00 IST News india Republic Day 2025: Kerala Lottery Akshaya AK-687 Draw for 26 January Postponed Read More

title: Shillong Sunday Teer Result, January 26, 2025 LIVE: Check Winning Numbers for First and Second Rounds
summary: Shillong Sunday Teer Result Today, January 26, 2025: Check the full list of common and winning numbers for the Morning Teer gamnes. In view of Republic Day, most Shillong Teer games will not be held today.
full_content: Shillong Sunday Teer Result, January 26, 2025 LIVE: Check Winning Numbers for First and Second Rounds Published By : News Desk Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 08:30 IST Shillong Sunday Teer Result Today, January 26, 2025: Check the full list of common and winning numbers for the Morning Teer gamnes. In view of Republic Day, most Shillong Teer games will not be held today. reset Follow us on Google News Shillong Teer is a legal archery-based lottery played in Meghalaya. (Image: Shutterstock) SHILLONG SUNDAY TEER RESULT TODAY, JANUARY 26, 2025 LIVE UPDATES: The Khasi Hills Archery Sports Association organises Shillong Teer, a unique lottery game managed by the Meghalaya Lottery Department. Hosted daily at the Shillong Polo Stadium, this event promotes archery among the youth while offering participants the chance to win exciting prizes. However, in view of Republic Day, most Shillong Teer games will not be held today. Below are the winning numbers for the Shillong Morning Teer and Juwai Morning Teer games. WINNING NUMBERS FOR JANUARY 26 related stories SHILLONG SUNDAY MORNING TEER First Round Result at 10:30 am Second Round Result at 11:30 am JUWAI SUNDAY MORNING TEER RESULT First Round Result at 10:30 am Second Round Result at 11:30 am HOW TO PLAY SHILLONG LOTTERY? There are two rounds in the game, and each one lasts exactly two minutes. In the first round, archers shoot 30 arrows, and in the second, 20. In one or both rounds, players bet on the number of arrows that will strike the target. Participants predict by selecting a number between 0 and 99. If the chosen number coincides with the outcome of any round, the player wins. Authorised merchants sell tickets for Rs 1, Rs 5, Rs 10, Rs 20, or Rs 50. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all In the Shillong Teer lottery, the reward amount is determined by the total number of bets placed and the precision of the participant’s accuracy. For instance, in the first round, a Rs 1 bet can yield a reward of Rs 80, while the same bet in the second round offers Rs 60. If a contestant accurately predicts the outcomes of both rounds with a Rs 1 wager each, they stand to earn up to Rs 4,000. The Khasi Hills Archery Sports Association (KHASA) depends on these special lottery games for money and assistance. Results are posted on meghalayateer.com and the official KHASA website. In addition, Meghalaya conducts daily Teer lotteries, including Khanapara Teer, Jowai Teer, and Ladrymbai Teer. To view the most recent information and winning numbers, visit the official designated website. tags : Shillong Shillong lottery Shillong Lottery Result Shillong Teer Location : Shillong, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 08:30 IST News india Shillong Sunday Teer Result, January 26, 2025 LIVE: Check Winning Numbers for First and Second Rounds Read More

title: Shah Rukh Khan To Get Rs 9 Crore Refund From State For 'Mannat'
summary: The Maharashtra Government would be refunding Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan Rs 9 crore that he had paid in excess to convert the lease of his seafacing bungalow `Mannat'.
full_content: Shah Rukh Khan To Get Rs 9 Crore Refund From State For 'Mannat' Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 08:22 IST The Maharashtra Government would be refunding Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan Rs 9 crore that he had paid in excess to convert the lease of his seafacing bungalow `Mannat'. reset Follow us on Google News Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan (File) The Maharashtra Government would be refunding Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan Rs 9 crore that he had paid in excess to convert the lease of his sea-facing bungalow `Mannat’. Resident suburban collector Satish Bagal said on Saturday that in 2019, Shah rukh Khan and his wife Gauri Khan converted the lease of the heritage property in Bandra to `class 1 complete ownership’, and paid the government some premium for it. related stories After discovering a tabulation error on the basis of which the premium was calculated, the Khans filed an application before the revenue authority for refund which was sanctioned earlier this week, he said. The actor had reportedly paid upwards of Rs 25 crore in premium, but officials did not confirm the figure immediately. title: Republic Day 2025: At 21, CRPF Bags Highest Number Of Gallantry Medals
summary: A total of 95 bravery medals have been awarded to the personnel of state and central police forces, fire service, home guard and civil defence and correctional services through an order issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA).
full_content: Republic Day 2025: At 21, CRPF Bags Highest Number Of Gallantry Medals Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 08:13 IST A total of 95 bravery medals have been awarded to the personnel of state and central police forces, fire service, home guard and civil defence and correctional services through an order issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). reset Follow us on Google News The CRPF, with about 3.25 lakh personnel, is the mainstay for internal security duties in the country. The CRPF has been awarded the highest number of police gallantry medals, 21, among all central and state police forces including two defence ministry issued Shaurya Chakras on the eve of the 76th Republic Day on Saturday. A total of 95 bravery medals have been awarded to the personnel of state and central police forces, fire service, home guard and civil defence and correctional services through an order issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). related stories The Ministry of Defence also announced two Shaurya Chakras for the CoBRA commandos of the force — Deputy Commandant Vikrant Kumar and Inspector Jeffrey Hmingchullo — for undertaking a daring operations against Maoists in Jharkhand during 2023. As per their citation, these personnel from the 203 Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) displayed "exceptional" bravery during an anti-Naxal operation that took place on April 2, 203 in Chatra district of the state leading to the killing of five "top" Maoists and recovery of a cache of weapons and ammunition. The Shaurya Chakra is the third highest peacetime military gallantry medal. A senior officer of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) said that out of the 19 police medals for gallantry (GM), 11 are for operations undertaken in Jammu and Kashmir, seven for acts of bravery in anti-Maoist operations and one for courage displayed during an operation in the northeast. The awardees include second-in-command rank officer Narender Yadav, and Assistant Commandants Amit Kumar and Vinay Kumar who have been conferred with the 1st bar to GM (gallantry medal awarded for the second time). Late Constable Sunil Kumar Pandey has been named for the medal posthumously. The 186th battalion jawan laid down his life in September 2023 in Assam while stopping bike-borne smugglers who trafficked contraband from Assam to Arunachal Pradesh. The assailants attacked him with a knife. After the CRPF, the country’s largest paramilitary force, the highest number of medals went to Uttar Pradesh (17), Jammu and Kashmir (15), Chhattisgarh (11) and Border Security Force (5). Three Border Security Force (BSF) personnel deployed under the United Nations (UN) flag in Congo have also been honoured with the gallantry medal. Inspector Jitu Deori, Constable Ratan Kumar Yogi and Constable Awdhesh Kumar Yadav displayed "exemplary courage" in rescuing 38 unarmed UN staff members from a violent mob that attacked their camp in Butembo on July 26, 2022. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The BSF is primarily tasked with guarding Indian borders with Pakistan and Bangladesh apart from rendering a variety of other security duties. The CRPF, with about 3.25 lakh personnel, is the mainstay for internal security duties in the country. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : CRPF Gallantry Awards mha Padma awards republic day Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 08:13 IST News india Republic Day 2025: At 21, CRPF Bags Highest Number Of Gallantry Medals Read More

title: Republic Day 2025 LIVE: UP Tableau Features MahaKumbh; Bihar Showcases Nalanda, Buddhist Heritage
summary: Republic Day 2025 Live Updates: The parade kicked off at 10:30 am from Kartavya Path, with PM Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu leading the ceremonies.
full_content: Live now Republic Day 2025 LIVE: UP Tableau Features MahaKumbh; Bihar Showcases Nalanda, Buddhist Heritage Curated By : News Desk News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 11:53 IST Republic Day 2025 Live Updates: The parade kicked off at 10:30 am from Kartavya Path, with PM Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu leading the ceremonies. reset Follow us on Google News : UP Tableau Features MahaKumbh; Bihar Showcases Nalanda, Buddhist Heritage Happy Republic Day 2025 Live Updates : As the nation comes together to celebrate the pride and spirit of Republic Day today (January 26), Kartavya Path in the heart of the capital hosts a grand parade showcasing India’s strength and unity. The parade features contingents from the Indian Armed Forces and paramilitary forces, with a total of 18 marching units, 15 bands, and 31 tableaux on display. The event began with Prime Minister Narendra Modi performing a wreath-laying ceremony at the National War Memorial followed by President Droupadi Murmu unfurling the Indian flag at Kartavya Path, marking the start of the Republic Day parade. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto will be the chief guest for the occasion. At least 10,000 special guests have been invited from across the country and a total of 7,70,000 passes and tickets have been issued. Each year, the government selects a theme for the Republic Day celebrations, and this year’s theme is “ Swarnim Bharat: Virasat aur Vikas ” (Golden India: Heritage and Progress). Watch 26th January Republic Day Parade Live from Kartavya Path Jan 26, 2025 11:53 IST Share this Article WhatsApp facebook Twitter telegram copy link Cultural Performance By 5,000 Artists Begins For the first time, the cultural performance will cover the entire Kartavya Path – from Vijay Chowk to C hexagon – to ensure all guests get the same viewing experience. This year, 5,000 artists under the title of ‘Jayati Jaya Mamaḧ Bharatam’ will perform over 45 dance forms from different parts of the country in an 11-minute cultural performance. Jan 26, 2025 11:51 IST Share this Article WhatsApp facebook Twitter telegram copy link Social Justice Ministry's Tableau Celebrates the Constitution at Republic Day Parade The Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment’s tableau at the Republic Day parade paid tribute to the Constitution of India, portraying it as the cornerstone of the nation’s heritage, development and guidance for the future. The tableau captured the essence of justice, equality, and liberty, showcasing how the Constitution continues to shape India into a united, progressive and inclusive society. Jan 26, 2025 11:51 IST Share this Article WhatsApp facebook Twitter telegram copy link Jharkhand Tableau Showcases Heritage, Progress at Republic Day Parade Jharkhand’s tableau at the Republic Day parade on Sunday highlighted the state’s legacy of heritage and progress under the theme “Swarnim Jharkhand: A Legacy of Heritage and Progress.” The tableau’s front portion featured two girls using laptops, symbolising the state’s growing educational infrastructure and its emphasis on accessible education for students, particularly tribal children, in both urban and rural areas. The middle portion depicted rural women engaged in crafting handicrafts, reflecting Jharkhand’s vibrant cultural traditions. Adorned with Sohrai murals—tribal art that celebrates harvest, fertility, and the state’s connection with nature and spirituality—the tableau underscored its cultural richness. Jan 26, 2025 11:50 IST Share this Article WhatsApp facebook Twitter telegram copy link Lakhpati Didi Scheme Displayed at Republic Day Parade to Showcase Women's Entrepreneurship The Rural Development Ministry’s tableau at the Republic Day parade paid tribute to the Lakhpati Didi scheme, which aims to ensure a minimum income of Rs 1 lakh to members of Self Help Groups, at the Kartavya Path, showcasing women’s economic empowerment through entrepreneurship. A towering symbolic statue of a Lakhpati Didi holding a bundle of money symbolising her financial self- sufficiency featured at the front of the tableau. Scenes of women engaging in different economic activities, such as weaving, handicrafts and agriculture, was displayed, celebrating their entrepreneurship. title: Happy Republic Day 2025: 76+ Inspiring Quotes And Slogans By Freedom Fighters!
summary: Happy Republic Day Quotes: India marks its 76th Republic Day this year on January 26. Celebrate the day with 76+ inspiring quotes and slogans by freedom fighters, along with motivational quotes for students
full_content: Happy Republic Day 2025: 76+ Inspiring Quotes And Slogans By Freedom Fighters! Published By : Nibandh Vinod Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 09:05 IST Happy Republic Day Quotes: India marks its 76th Republic Day this year on January 26. Celebrate the day with 76+ inspiring quotes and slogans by freedom fighters, along with motivational quotes for students reset Follow us on Google News Happy Republic Day 2025: Celebrate Republic Day 2025 with inspiring quotes, slogans, and motivation from freedom fighters and for students! (Image: Shutterstock) Happy Republic Day 2025: Republic Day, annually celebrated on January 26, marks the adoption of India’s constitution as the country transitioned to a republic in 1950. Although India gained independence in 1947, it became a sovereign state and was officially declared a Republic in 1950, when its Constitution came into effect. As we celebrate India’s 76th Republic Day today on January 26, here are some quotes/slogans by famous Indian freedom fighters to honour the country and its legacy. ALSO READ: Happy Republic Day 2025: Heartfelt Wishes, Images, Quotes, Messages And WhatsApp Status To Share related stories Republic Day 2025: Quotes By Freedom Fighters Republic Day Quote: “Freedom is not given; it is taken. Fight for your rights" – Lala Lajpat Rai. (Image: Shutterstock) “So long as you do not achieve social liberty, whatever freedom is provided by the law is of no avail to you" – BR Ambedkar. “Merciless criticism and independent thinking are the two necessary traits of revolutionary thinking." – Bhagat Singh. “Sarfaroshi ki tamanna ab hamare dil me hai, dekhna hai zor kitna baazu-e-qaatil me hai." – Bismil Azimabadi. “Let a new India arise out of peasants’ cottages, grasping the plough, out of huts, cobbler, and sweeper." – Swami Vivekananda. “Swaraj is my birthright and I shall have it." – Bal Gangadhar Tilak. “Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes" – Mahatma Gandhi. “Democracy is not merely a form of government. It is primarily a mode of associated living, of conjoint communicated experience. It is essentially an attitude of respect and reverence towards fellow men" – BR Ambedkar. “Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark" – Rabindranath Tagore." “Arise, awake and stop not till the goal is reached" – Swami Vivekananda. “One individual may die for an idea, but that idea will, after his death, incarnate itself in a thousand lives" – Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. “The sanctity of law can be maintained only so as long as it is the expression of the will of the people" – Bhagat Singh. “The shots that hit me are the last nails to the coffin of British rule in India" – Lala Lajpat Rai. “Let us all be brave enough to die the death of a martyr, but let no one lust for martyrdom." – Mahatma Gandhi “Satyameva Jayate" – Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya “Swaraj is my birthright, and I shall have it!" – Bal Gangadhar Tilak “I measure the progress of a community by the degree of progress which women have achieved." – BR Ambedkar. “We gain freedom when we have paid the full price" – Rabindranath Tagore “The preservation of freedom is not the task of soldiers alone. The whole nation has to be strong." – Lal Bahadur Shastri “Let new India arise out of peasants’ cottage, grasping the plough, out of huts, cobbler and sweeper." – Swami Vivekananda “A country’s greatness lies in its undying ideals of love and sacrifice that inspire the mothers of the race." – Sarojini Naidu “The shots that hit me are the last nails to the coffin of British rule in India" – Lala Lajpat Rai “Freedom is never dear at any price. It is the breath of life. What would a man not pay for living?" – Mahatma Gandhi “Knowledge with humility is worthless" – Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya “Freedom is the birthright of every nation." – Annie Besant “We will face the bullets of the enemy; we are free and will remain free" – Chandra Shekhar Azad “Freedom is not given; it is taken. Fight for your rights" – Lala Lajpat Rai “They may kill me, but they cannot kill my ideas. They can crush my body, but they will not be able to crush my spirit" – Bhagat Singh “An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind" – Mahatma Gandhi. “‘Revolution’ does not necessarily involve sanguinary strife nor is there any place in it for individual vendetta. It is not the cult of the bomb and the pistol. By ‘Revolution’ we mean that the present order of things, which is based on manifest injustice, must change." – Bhagat Singh “Blood and tears are going to be our lot, whether we like them or not. Our blood and tears will flow; maybe the parched soil of India needs them so that the fine flower of freedom may grow again." –Jawaharlal Nehru “The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence." – Rabindranath Tagore “A nation’s culture resides in the hearts and the soul of its people." – Mahatma Gand...

title: Aaj Ka Panchang, 26 January, 2025: Tithi, Vrat, Shubh Muhurat, And Ashubh Muhurat
summary: Aaj Ka Panchang, January 26, 2025: Devotees will celebrate Shattila Ekadashi Parana today on Sunday.
full_content: Aaj Ka Panchang, 26 January, 2025: Tithi, Vrat, Shubh Muhurat, And Ashubh Muhurat Published By : News Desk Trending Desk Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 05:00 IST Aaj Ka Panchang, January 26, 2025: Devotees will celebrate Shattila Ekadashi Parana today on Sunday. reset Follow us on Google News Aaj Ka Panchang, January 26, 2025: The sun will rise at 7:12 AM and set at 5:56 PM. (Image: Shutterstock) AAJ KA PANCHANG, JANUARY 26, 2025: The Dwadashi and Trayodashi Tithis of Krishna Paksha will take place on Sunday, January 26. Festivals like Shattila Ekadashi Parana will be observed today nationwide. In Hinduism, the calendar is divided into Tithis, each of which has a distinct significance and influence on certain activities. Activities made during auspicious Tithis are believed to produce positive results, whereas activities held during unfavourable seasons may result in difficulties. SUNRISE, SUNSET, MOONRISE, AND MOONSET ON JANUARY 26 related stories As per Drik Panchang, the sun will rise at 7:12 AM and set at 5:56 PM. The moon is anticipated to rise at 5:29 AM on January 27 and set at 2:37 PM. TITHI, NAKSHATRA, AND RASHI DETAILS FOR JANUARY 26 After the Dwadashi Tithi ends at 8:54 PM, it will transit to Trayodashi Tithi. The Jyeshtha Nakshatra will be there till 8:26 AM and will then transit to Mula Nakshatra. The sun will stay in Makara Rashi, and the moon will be in Vrishchika Rashi upto 8:26 AM and will transit to Dhanu Rashi. SHUBH MUHURAT FOR JANUARY 26 The Brahma Muhurta will be held from 5:26 AM to 6:19 AM on this day, and the Pratah Sandhya Muhurta will be observed from 5:52 AM to 7:12 AM. The time frame for the Vijaya Muhurta is 2:21 PM to 3:04 PM. The Sayahna Sandhya Muhurta is scheduled from 5:56 PM to 7:15 PM, while the Godhuli Muhurta is scheduled from 5:53 PM to 6:20 PM. On January 27, the Nishita Muhurta is scheduled to take place from 12:07 AM to 1 AM. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all ASHUBH MUHURAT FOR JANUARY 26 The Yamaganda Muhurat is scheduled for 12:34 PM to 1:54 PM, and the Rahu Kalam Muhurat is scheduled for 4:35 PM to 5:56 PM. The Gulikai Kalam Muhurat is scheduled to take place from 3:15 PM to 4:35 PM. From 4:30 PM to 5:13 PM, the Dur Muhurat will be observed. In Raja, the Baana Muhurat will be observed from 3:40 AM till full night on January 27. tags : Aaj ka Panchang Aaj Ka Panchang 2025 Hindu Panchang Panchang Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 05:00 IST News india Aaj Ka Panchang, 26 January, 2025: Tithi, Vrat, Shubh Muhurat, And Ashubh Muhurat Read More

title: 'Bengal Govt's Criticism Made Me Famous Nationwide': Kartik Maharaj On Padma Shri Honour
summary: Kartik Maharaj recalled Mamata Banerjee’s criticism, where she alleged that some monks from the Bharat Sevashram Sangha were aiding the BJP in Lok Sabha elections.
full_content: 'Bengal Govt's Criticism Made Me Famous Nationwide': Kartik Maharaj On Padma Shri Honour Reported By : Kamalika Sengupta News18.com Edited By: Ronit Singh Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 00:34 IST Kartik Maharaj recalled Mamata Banerjee’s criticism, where she alleged that some monks from the Bharat Sevashram Sangha were aiding the BJP in Lok Sabha elections. reset Follow us on Google News Bharat Sevashram Sangha monk Kartik Maharaj | Image/CNN-News18 Padma Award 2025: Sevashram Sangha monk Kartik Maharaj, also known as Pradiptananda Maharaj, expressed gratitude to the central government for conferring him the Padma Shri award on Republic Day eve. Kartik Maharaj, a monk who found himself at the centre of a row between the Trinamool Congress (TMC) and the BJP in West Bengal during the Lok Sabha elections 2024, was among the nine recipients of the Padma Shri award from West Bengal. related stories Speaking exclusively to CNN-News18 , Kartik Maharaj recalled Mamata Banerjee’s criticism, where she alleged that some monks from the Bharat Sevashram Sangha were aiding the BJP in Lok Sabha elections, working against the TMC in the state. “I thank the Bengal government and the state ruling party. Their criticism of me and my work helped my efforts gain nationwide recognition. Their advertisements made me famous across India. Earlier, I was only known in Murshidabad, but now I am known nationwide," Maharaj told CNN-News18 . “People began to explore what I had done after hearing their (Mamata Banerjee’s) remarks. Everyone now knows about my work and who Swamiji is. For this, I sincerely thank Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee," he added. ‘Heartfelt Thanks To Centre’ Kartik Maharaj, the secretary of the Beldanga branch of the Bharat Sevashram Sangha in Murshidabad, expressed his heartfelt gratitude to the central government for honouring his welfare works with the Padma award. “Those who wear saffron do not seek awards, rewards, or appreciation. Our organisation, Bharat Sevashram Sangh, along with our hospital and school, will benefit greatly from this recognition," Maharaj said. “Thousands of people receive treatment here, and this award will serve as a major inspiration for all these efforts. I extend my heartfelt thanks to the Government of India. In Bengal, Swami Vivekanand ji began the mission of serving the people, and we are continuing that legacy, as envisioned by Bharat Sevashram Sangh founder Pranabananda Ji," he added. Caught In TMC, BJP Crossfire In May 2024, as national political tensions escalated ahead of the Lok Sabha elections, a Sevashram monk became the focal point of the TMC-BJP conflict in West Bengal. Kartik Maharaj sent a legal notice to Chief Minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee, demanding an apology from the CM for her alleged defamatory comments about his organisation. His lawyer stated that the monk had dedicated his life to “humanity" and to modernising Hindu society while preserving the core values of ancient Hindu traditions. He referred to Banerjee’s purported remarks that some monks of the Bharat Sevashram Sangha and Ramakrishna Mission were allegedly working hand in hand with the BJP in the state and said, “The Chief Minister will never be able to prove her accusations. I am a monk, not a politician." top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Maharaj also took to the streets, launching a statewide protest demanding an apology from Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Who Is Kartik Maharaj? Kartik Maharaj joined the Bharat Sevashram Sangha as a teenager and became a leader in his early 20s. He was assigned to Beldanga, Murshidabad, where he developed an ashram and contributed to building schools and hospitals. He is also credited with promoting girls’ education in the region. Despite his significant social work, Kartik Maharaj asserts that he has never been involved in politics. Location : Kolkata, India First Published: January 26, 2025, 00:09 IST News india 'Bengal Govt's Criticism Made Me Famous Nationwide': Kartik Maharaj On Padma Shri Honour Read More

full_content: Maha Kumbh: DGCA Asks Airlines To Rationalise Airfares For Prayagraj Flights Agency: PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 23:55 IST The DGCA asked airlines to rationalise airfares for flights to Prayagraj amid the Maha Kumbh amid concerns over higher air tickets on the route. reset Follow us on Google News The Maha Kumbh Mela kickstarted in Prayagraj on January 13. Aviation watchdog DGCA has asked airlines to rationalise airfares for flights to Prayagraj in view of the Maha Kumbh amid concerns over higher air tickets on the route. Airlines, including SpiceJet, are operating more flights to Prayagraj. related stories To meet increased demand for air travel, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has approved 81 additional flights in January, increasing the air connectivity to Prayagraj to 132 flights from across the country. In a post on X on Saturday, the regulator said that in view of the likely surge in demand, airlines have been urged to increase further capacity by adding flights and rationalise fares. In view of likely surge in demand, DG (CA) met airlines on 23 January 2025 and urged them to increase further capacity by adding flights and rationalize fares.— DGCA (@DGCAIndia) January 25, 2025 DGCA officials held a meeting with airline representatives on January 23 in this regard. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Bookings as well as airfares for flights to Prayagraj have jumped multi-fold as more people travel for the Maha Kumbh, with the air ticket prices rising up to 21 per cent for the Delhi-Prayagraj flights, an analysis by travel portal Ixigo showed earlier this month. The Maha Kumbh, which started on January 13, will conclude on February 26. title: Who Is Chandrakant Sompura? Ayodhya Ram Mandir Architect Conferred Padma Shri Award
summary: Chandrakant Sompura hails from a family of architects who have designed more than 200 temples across the country over centuries. He came up with the Ram Mandir design in 1987.
full_content: Who Is Chandrakant Sompura? Ayodhya Ram Mandir Architect Conferred Padma Shri Award Curated By : Aveek Banerjee News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 23:17 IST Chandrakant Sompura hails from a family of architects who have designed more than 200 temples across the country over centuries. He came up with the Ram Mandir design in 1987. reset Follow us on Google News Chandrakant Sompura, who designed the iconic Ram Temple in Ayodhya, was conferred the Padma Shri award. (Photo: X) The Central government on Saturday announced the list of recipients for Padma Awards 2025 on the eve of Republic Day. President Droupadi Murmu approved the conferment of 139 Padma awards, comprising seven Padma Vibhushan, 19 Padma Bhushan and 113 Padma Shri Awards. One of the Padma Shri recipients is Chandrakant Sompura, 81, the architect of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya. Sompura belongs to a family of temple architects who have designed over 200 such structures across the country over centuries. related stories It was Sompura’s grandfather Prabhashankar Sompura who designed the revived Somnath temple in Gujarat’s Prabhas Patan in 1949. The Sompura family has a long list of temple creations to their credit, including the Akshardham temple complex in Gujarat, the Swaminarayan Mandir in Mumbai and the famed Birla Mandir in Kolkata. According to Times Now, he is the 15th generation of a family that has been into designing temple architecture in India and abroad. The creation of the Birla Mandir in Kolkata had reported impressed the Vishwa Hindu Parishad’s (VHP) late president Ashok Singhal. Padma Awards 2025 Full List How Sompura Came Up With Ram Mandir Design? In an interview from 2020, Sompura revealed that he was contacted by Ashok Singhal through the Birla family to come up with a design for the Ram Temple in Ayodhya around 33 years ago. “We met and discussed the construction of the temple and had to go to Ayodhya to recce the land. With so much security present, I had to disguise myself as a devotee and measure the area with footsteps to make the masterplan," he told Outlook India . Chandrakant Sompura inspecting the construction work along with his team in 2023. (PTI) He came up with a design for the Ram Temple in 1987, which was agreed upon in a meeting of saints during the Kumbh Mela in 1990. The design of the Ram temple was later upgraded by Sompura and his sons Ashish and Nikhil. Ashish said the temple was created with a 3D structural analysis by the Central Building Research Institute in Roorkee to ensure that it could withstand strong earthquakes. The Sompura family later explained that the temple was constructed using a traditional interlocking stone process and that Larsen & Toubro, the company that was awarded the contract, had to be persuaded of this method, according to The Indian Express . The Ram Mandir, designed in the traditional Nagara architectural style, measures 380 feet in length, 250 feet in width and reaches a height of 161 feet. Within the temple, the sanctum sanctorum houses the childhood form of Bhagwan Shri Ram (the idol of Shri Ram Lalla), while on the first floor, there is Shri Ram Darbar. The consecration ceremony of Ram Lalla idol in Ayodhya was held on January 22 last year, marking the end of 500 years of exile for the Lord’s devotees in India and across the country. Prime Minister Narendra Modi took part in the ‘pran pratishtha’ rituals in the presence of Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. The consecration ceremony of Ram Lalla idol in Ayodhya was held on January 22 last year. (PTI) The first anniversary of the consecration of Ram Mandir in Ayodhya was celebrated as ‘Pratishtha Dwadashi’ on January 11, 2025. The construction work is due to be completed by June this year. Padma Awards 2025 Announced Today A total of 139 names were announced – seven for Padma Vibhushan, 19 for Padma Bhushan, and 113 for Padma Shri. The awardees were recognised for their excellence in diverse fields like art, social work, science, medicine, and more, highlighting their contributions across various sectors. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Medicine expert Duvvur Nageshwar Reddy from Telangana, retired Justice Jagdish Singh Khehar from Chandigarh, and late singer Sharda Sinha from Bihar were honoured with the Padma Vibhushan. Another name that caught everyone’s attention was Bhim Singh Bhavesh, a social worker from Bhojpur who worked tirelessly for the upliftment of the Musahar community, one of society’s most marginalised groups, for the past 22 years through his foundation Nayee Asha’. tags : Ayodhya Ram mandir Padma awards padma shri ram temple Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 23:17 IST News india Who Is Chandrakant Sompura?
