title: India-Indonesia To Strengthen Ties In Cybersecurity, Maritime Security & De-radicalisation: PM Modi
summary: Prime Minister welcomed Indonesia's membership in BRICS and reiterated India's commitment to collaborating on the interests of Global South countries
full_content: India-Indonesia To Strengthen Ties In Cybersecurity, Maritime Security & De-radicalisation: PM Modi Agency: IANS Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 17:59 IST Prime Minister welcomed Indonesia's membership in BRICS and reiterated India's commitment to collaborating on the interests of Global South countries reset Follow us on Google News Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President of Indonesia Prabowo Subianto during a joint press statement after a meeting, at Hyderabad House, in New Delhi, Saturday. (PTI photo) Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto held bilateral talks on Saturday at Hyderabad House in the capital on Saturday, marking a significant step in reinforcing the ties between the two nations. Several Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) were exchanged during the meeting, covering areas such as health cooperation, digital infrastructure, and defence collaboration. related stories PM Modi emphasised Indonesia’s importance as a partner in the ASEAN and Indo-Pacific regions, reaffirming India’s commitment to ASEAN’s centrality and unity under its ‘Act East’ policy. We discussed ways to deepen India-Indonesia relations in areas such as security, defence manufacturing, trade, FinTech, AI and more. Sectors like food security, energy and disaster management are also areas where we look forward to working closely. pic.twitter.com/wyYcSPtuYr — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 25, 2025 “The year 2025 will be celebrated as India-ASEAN Year of Tourism. This will enhance cultural exchanges and promote tourism between India and Indonesia. Indonesia is an important partner for us in the ASEAN and Indo-Pacific regions. We both are committed to maintaining peace, security, prosperity and the rule of law in this region. We agree that freedom of navigation should be ensured in accordance with international laws," the Prime Minister said. “ASEAN unity and centrality has been emphasised in our ‘Act-East’ policy," PM Modi said. Highlighting the historical relationship, PM Modi said, “Indonesia was the chief guest on India’s first Republic Day, and as we celebrate 75 years of the Republic, it is a matter of great pride that Indonesia is part of this historic occasion." The Prime Minister noted the growing bilateral trade, which exceeded $30 billion last year, and announced enhanced cooperation in areas such as Fintech, Artificial Intelligence, the Internet of Things, and digital public infrastructure. He also mentioned collaborative efforts in maritime security, cyber security, counter-terrorism, and de-radicalisation. The significant agreements included maritime safety and security, aimed at bolstering crime prevention, search and rescue, and capacity building. Additionally, the partnership in energy, critical minerals, science, technology, and space was further strengthened. PM Modi also highlighted cultural and historical ties, referencing the Ramayana, Mahabharata and Bali Jatra, as well as India’s involvement in the conservation of Indonesia’s Prambanan Hindu Temple. India is honoured to welcome President Prabowo Subianto.When we marked our first Republic Day, Indonesia was the guest nation and now, when we are marking 75 years of India being a Republic, President Subianto will be attending the celebrations. We discussed various aspects of… pic.twitter.com/8YiWA8zlQb — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 25, 2025 Prime Minister welcomed Indonesia’s membership in BRICS and reiterated India’s commitment to collaborating on the interests of Global South countries. Prabowo expressed his gratitude to India for its longstanding support, noting that the Indonesian Embassy in India is located on land donated by the Indian government. Extending greetings to India on the 76th Republic Day, Prabowo said, “We feel very honoured that I will be the Chief Guest tomorrow at the Republic Day parade and because the first Chief Guest in India’s first Republic Day parade was President Sukarno, so this is a great honour for me. For the first time, an Indonesian military contingent has taken part in a military parade outside of Indonesia." “Indonesia considers India a long-time friend. India was one of the first strong supporters of our independence struggle. India sent assistance, financial aid, and medical aid in our struggle for independence. Many Indian leaders supported us in our critical times," he added. He also thanked India for supporting Indonesia’s permanent membership in BRICS, stating, “We are convinced that this cooperation will be beneficial to global stability and regional cooperation." India and Indonesia are closely cooperating in various multilateral platforms as well. Indonesia is at the core of our Act East Policy and we welcome Indonesia’s BRICS membership.— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 25, 2025 top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Prabowo highlighted that ongoing discussions will strengthen cooperation in trade, investment, tourism, health, energy, and te...

title: ‘If Sick People Bathe With Healthy…’: Congress Leader Raises Concerns Over Kumbh Arrangements
summary: Congress leader Hussain Dalwai added, "This could lead to widespread diseases, which must be prevented."
full_content: ‘If Sick People Bathe With Healthy…’: Congress Leader Raises Concerns Over Kumbh Arrangements Curated By : Manisha Roy News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 17:31 IST Congress leader Hussain Dalwai added, "This could lead to widespread diseases, which must be prevented." reset Follow us on Google News Dalwai said, People across the country have faith in religion. A large number of people go there to take a holy dip, but it is likely that the area may become unhygienic. (Image: IANS) Amid the ongoing Maha Kumbh in Uttar Pradesh’s Prayagraj, Congress leader Hussain Dalwai has raised concerns over the cleanliness arrangements for devotees. Congress leader Dalwai, citing the humongous crowd that arrives to take a holy dip at Sangam, expressed that the area is likely to become unhygienic. related stories Mumbai: Congress leader Hussain Dalwai on #Mahakumbh2025 says, “People across the country have faith in religion. A large number of people go there to take a holy dip, but it is likely that the area may become unhygienic. This could lead to widespread diseases, which must be… pic.twitter.com/E2pVs1ROA2 — IANS (@ians_india) January 25, 2025 Speaking to news agency IANS, Hussain Dalwai said, “People across the country have faith in religion. A large number of people go there to take a holy dip, but it is likely that the area may become unhygienic." He added, “This could lead to widespread diseases, which must be prevented." Giving example of settings for Hajj pilgrimage, Dalwai urged for a more systematic arrangements for the grand event, with focus on cleanliness. “Just as proper arrangements are made for the Hajj pilgrimage, similar arrangements should be made for the Kumbh Mela. The facilities for bathing should be well-organized. If sick individuals bathe with healthy people without any medical checkups, it could spread illnesses to healthy individuals," he said. ‘Anti-Sanatan Mindset’: BJP’s Shehzad Poonawalla Slams Congress top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Reacting to the Congress leader’s remarks, BJP’s Shehzad Poonawalla described it as “insulting". Poonawala accused the Congress for maintaining an “anti-Sanatan mindset." Poonawala said, “Congress’ senior leader statement is insulting….this shows Congress’ anti-Sanatan mindset…they have always insulted Sanatan." tags : kumbh mela Location : Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 17:23 IST News india ‘If Sick People Bathe With Healthy…’: Congress Leader Raises Concerns Over Kumbh Arrangements Read More

title: Yogi Adityanath To News18: 10 Crore Devotees In 10 Days, Maha Kumbh Will Account For 10% Of UP's GDP
summary: Yogi Adityanath, in an exclusive interview with Network18 Group Editor-in-Chief Rahul Joshi, said, "We expect 40-45 crore devotees to take a dip at the Maha Kumbh...UP and India will give a new economic principle to the world – whenever you recognise your strength, you will see this kind of growth."
full_content: Yogi Adityanath To News18: 10 Crore Devotees In 10 Days, Maha Kumbh Will Account For 10% Of UP's GDP Published By : News Desk News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 19:44 IST Yogi Adityanath, in an exclusive interview with Network18 Group Editor-in-Chief Rahul Joshi, said, "We expect 40-45 crore devotees to take a dip at the Maha Kumbh...UP and India will give a new economic principle to the world – whenever you recognise your strength, you will... Read More reset Follow us on Google News UP CM Yogi Adityanath during his interview with News18. Amid the ongoing Maha Kumbh , Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath, in an exclusive interview with Network18 Group Editor-in-Chief Rahul Joshi, said more than 10 crore devotees have visited the mela in the past 10 days. He added that economic activity from the Maha Kumbh is likely to account for 10% of the state’s GDP. related stories When asked to compare the footfall in the Ardha Kumbha in 2019 and this year’s Maha Kumbh, Adityanath said, “Usually, we would see huge crowds on Mauni Amavasya, but we are seeing similar numbers every day this time. In 2019, four crore devotees took bath in the Sangam on the day of Mauni Amavasya. This time, four crore devotees took bath in the Sangam on the day of Makar Sankranti itself. In the past 10 days, more than 10 crore devotees have taken a dip in the Sangam. Today [Saturday], more than 2 crore devotees are in the Maha Kumbh area for the holy dip. This will go on till February 3. On Mauni Amavasya, we expect the crowds to multiply three-five times compared to 2019." #CMYogiOnNews18 | Uttar Pradesh should remain united and attain its goals. Unity is the state's strength. The state's respect lies in the same: UP CM @myogiadityanath speaks with @18RahulJoshi #DelhiElection2025 #UttarPradesh pic.twitter.com/4eSw6pcU6B — News18 (@CNNnews18) January 25, 2025 Giving an estimate on the footfall, he said, “In my estimate, the 45-day congregation at Mahakumbh will see a footfall that will be equivalent to the third largest population in the world…after India and China…in this temporary set-up." “We expect 40-45 crore devotees will give the message of national unity through the holy dip," said the UP CM. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all When asked about the Rs 7,500-crore spent on organising the event, the CM clarified, “The expenditure of Rs 7,500 crore is not of the Maha Kumbh alone. The money has also gone towards boosting the connectivity of Prayagraj city, on highways, railway stations, airports. A major chunk of the amount has been spent on the development of roads, overbridges, underpasses, flyovers, etc. for the city." Elaborating on how the event could boost the state’s economy, Adityanath said, “The congregation of people at the Maha Kumbh will lead to a growth of Rs 2 lakh crore in the economy of Uttar Pradesh. UP and India will give a new economic principle to the world – whenever you recognise your strength, you will see this kind of growth…The Maha Kumbh’s contribution to UP’s GDP will be 10%." tags : Kumbh kumbh mela mahakumbh news18 specials Yogi Adityanath Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 17:13 IST News india Yogi Adityanath To News18: 10 Crore Devotees In 10 Days, Maha Kumbh Will Account For 10% Of UP's GDP Read More

title: Prime Suspect In Murder Of Five In Meerut Killed In Police Encounter
summary: A police team tracked down Naeem on Saturday morning. Police are still on the lookout for Salman.
full_content: Prime Suspect In Murder Of Five In Meerut Killed In Police Encounter Published By : News Desk PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 16:37 IST A police team tracked down Naeem on Saturday morning. Police are still on the lookout for Salman. reset Follow us on Google News In a statement, police said that a team tracked down Jameel Hussain alias Naeem on Saturday morning and an encounter ensued. (ANI photo) A man who is the prime suspect in the murder of five of his family members and carrying a reward of Rs 50,000 on his head was killed in a police encounter early morning on Saturday, officials said. In a statement, police said that a team tracked down Jameel Hussain alias Naeem on Saturday morning and an encounter ensued. “Naeem sustained gunshot injuries and was declared dead at a nearby hospital," reads the statement. related stories Naeem was the prime suspect in the gruesome murder of five people — his stepbrother Moin and his wife and their three children — at the latter’s residence at Lisari Gate on January 9. The victims were found dead with head injuries. Following the murders, police had announced a reward for Naeem and his accomplice, Salman. “Investigations revealed that Naeem, who had a history of criminal activities in Delhi and Thane, had been changing his name and location to evade arrest. The motive behind the heinous crime was a dispute over money and property," a statement shared by Director General of Police (DGP) of UP Prashant Kumar read. A police team tracked down Naeem on Saturday morning. Police are still on the lookout for Salman. “Naeem was located in Madina Colony on Saturday morning where a police team surrounded the area based on intelligence reports. During the operation, Naeem opened fire on the police. In the ensuing exchange of gunfire, Naeem was injured and was rushed to the hospital. However, doctors later declared him dead from his injuries," said Meerut Superintendent of Police Vipin Tada. Tada said that Naeem was also wanted in Delhi and Maharashtra where he is implicated in murder cases. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Meerut police formed five teams to catch him after he murdered the entire family of his stepbrother, Moin alias Moinuddin (52), his wife Asma (45), and their daughters Afsah (8), Aziza (4), and Adeeba (1). Police said the bodies of the husband and wife were found wrapped in bedsheets, while those of their three children were stuffed in the storage compartment of a bed at the family’s home in the densely populated Suhail Garden neighbourhood in the Lisari Gate police station area. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) Location : Meerut, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 16:37 IST News india Prime Suspect In Murder Of Five In Meerut Killed In Police Encounter Read More

title: Gautam Buddh Nagar Traffic Police Issues Advisory For R-Day Celebrations in Delhi
summary: The restrictions aim to prevent goods vehicles from entering Delhi for the safety purposes during the Republic Day celebrations on Sunday.
full_content: Gautam Buddh Nagar Traffic Police Issues Advisory For R-Day Celebrations in Delhi Published By : News Desk PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 16:23 IST The restrictions aim to prevent goods vehicles from entering Delhi for the safety purposes during the Republic Day celebrations on Sunday. reset Follow us on Google News Moreover, vehicles entering Delhi via Yamuna Expressway to the Noida-Greater Noida Expressway will be diverted from Zero point to Pari Chowk to the Eastern Peripheral Expressway and further. (PTI file photo) Gautam Buddh Nagar Traffic Police has issued an advisory restricting the movement of goods vehicles, including heavy, medium and light vehicles, in view of Republic Day. The advisory will be in effect from 10 pm on January 25 until the conclusion of Republic Day program on January 26, officials said. related stories The restrictions aim to prevent goods vehicles from entering Delhi for the safety purposes during the Republic Day celebrations on Sunday. According to the advisory, vehicles entering Delhi from Chilla Red Light border will take a U-turn there and head towards their destinations via the Noida, Greater Noida Expressway to the Eastern Peripheral Expressway. The vehicles coming to Delhi from the DND border will be able take a U-turn from the toll plaza there and move towards the Noida, Greater Noida Expressway and further to the Eastern Peripheral Expressway to reach their destinations. The vehicles moving to Delhi from the Kalindi Kunj Yamuna border will be diverted from the underpass intersection before river Yamuna and go towards the Noida, Greater Noida Expressway to the Peripheral Expressway. Moreover, vehicles entering Delhi via Yamuna Expressway to the Noida-Greater Noida Expressway will be diverted from Zero point to Pari Chowk to the Eastern Peripheral Expressway and further. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Deputy Commissioner of Police, Traffic, Lakhan Singh Yadav said vehicle drivers should follow the alternate route option plans to avoid any inconvenience. Route plan can be changed as per the situation, he added. title: 'Bengaluru Closed For North India': Social Media Post On Kannada Goes Viral, Sparks Debate
summary: A social media post stating that "Bengaluru is closed for North India" has gone viral, generating debate about the Kannada language row online.
full_content: 'Bengaluru Closed For North India': Social Media Post On Kannada Goes Viral, Sparks Debate Published By : Ronit Singh PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 16:06 IST A social media post stating that "Bengaluru is closed for North India" has gone viral, generating debate about the Kannada language row online. reset Follow us on Google News The post on X garnered significant attention, with over one lakh views, 250 reshares, and 2,000 likes.(X/@Paarmatma) A social media post stating that “Bengaluru is closed for North India" has gone viral, generating debate about the Kannada language row online. In a post on ‘X’, a social media user stated: “Bengaluru is closed for North India and neighbouring states who don’t want to learn Kannada. They don’t need Bengaluru if they can’t respect the language and culture." related stories Bengaluru is closed for north India and neighbouring states who doesn’t want to learn KannadaThey don’t need Bengaluru when they can’t respect language and culture #Kannada #Bengaluru #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/YNmgQwJToH — ಬಬ್ರುವಾಹನ (@Paarmatma) January 23, 2025 The recent post by Babruvahana (@Paarmatma) has garnered significant attention, with over 115,000 views, 198 reposts, and 1,839 likes. (at the time this was written) Reacting to the post, a social media user who claimed to be a “migrant to Bengaluru" said the post might sound a bit harsh. “But whenever I see people in Bengaluru completely disregard Kannada as some sort of tribal language and even look down on those who speak Kannada as illiterates, even in corporate offices, I feel very pained. Kannada is a phenomenally rich language that has received the most literary awards, including Sahitya Akademi and Jnanpith awards (sic)," he said. He suggested it was time for Kannadigas to create a movement for Kannada pride in a positive way rather than resorting to a negative backlash. “There is nothing chauvinistic about being proud of one’s language and culture," he said. Another social media user expressed a different perspective, stating that Bengaluru exists today because of hardworking people from other states who contributed to its development. “Today, Bengaluru is here because of hardworking people from other states who put in all the effort to develop this city. Don’t forget that! Now that everything is built, do you want others to leave? Shame on Kannada people and the government of Karnataka for sitting idly by (sic)," he said. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Another user, while agreeing to learn Kannada, demanded that the state government hire good teachers to teach Kannada in offices. “Okay, I’ll learn… But ask your government to use Kannada code language to develop applications, and more importantly, ask them to hire good Kannada teachers to teach in offices. Also, ask your government to send all other state people back to their states (sic)," the user stated. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : bengaluru Location : Bengaluru, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 16:06 IST News india 'Bengaluru Closed For North India': Social Media Post On Kannada Goes Viral, Sparks Debate Read More

title: ‘Invest In Relationships, Get A Good Night’s Sleep’: Jaishankar’s Advice On Managing Stress At Shiv Khera’s Book Launch
summary: Speaking at the book release of 'Live While You're Alive' by Shiv Khera, Jaishankar shared some anecdotes from his life and career as a diplomat and advised people on how to manage stress.
full_content: ‘Invest In Relationships, Get A Good Night’s Sleep’: Jaishankar’s Advice On Managing Stress At Shiv Khera’s Book Launch Reported By : Aveek Banerjee News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 23:21 IST Speaking at the book release of 'Live While You're Alive' by Shiv Khera, Jaishankar shared some anecdotes from his life and career as a diplomat and advised people on how to manage stress. reset Follow us on Google News External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar speaking at the book release of Shiv Khera's 'Live While You're Alive'. (S Jaishankar/X) Whether you are unhappy with your job, or are working long hours, or you are newly married or have kids – stress is a normal part of your life. Managing stress has become the key priority of our lives, but we often go the wrong way about this. In this regard, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar had unique advices for people on how to manage stress. The minister emphasised the need for developing confidence to manage stress, self-motivation and accept the mistakes of your lives and rectify them. “No one is perfect. People normally talk about your success, and you talk about your own success. It would be very interesting if we pause for a moment and thought where you did not do that," he said, adding that he always remembered the exams he did not clear. related stories The External Affairs Minister was speaking in Delhi at the book release of author Shiv Khera’s ‘ Live While You’re Alive’ , which deals with several aspects of stress management and work-life balance. In his keynote address, Jaishankar shared anecdotes from his personal life and his career as a diplomat and politician to advice people on how to manage stress. Jaishankar’s 3Cs Of Success “Most people obviously understand that I passed the UPSC, but I sat for the IIT entrance exam and I did not pass. Recently, I was attending an event and someone went through the great trouble of getting my school report. They got a copy of it, had a presentable version of it, and they were under the mistaken impression that it would be a good report," he said at the event. Jaishankar stressed that no one should feel dejected after a setback and constantly strive for self-improvement. “When I look at my own particular responsibilities now but even earlier as diplomat, I had to aspire to reach the 3Cs of success. Contact – the more people you know, the greater your reach. Chemistry – If you get along with people, they are more likely to do things for you. Credibility – if you are known to be good on words, people take you seriously," he said. The EAM also quipped that avoiding chronic stress and being a minister don’t go too well, drawing some laughs from the audience. “My most honest answer (to manage chronic stress), you normalise the abnormal. You build your life around it, you de-stress it by making it a part of your life. If your phone rings in at 2 in the night, you answer it and go back to sleep and get up at 6 or 7 and try to remember and hope what you said was right." ‘Invest In Relationships, Get A Good Night’s Sleep’ Jaishankar also shared his six takeaways from Shiv Khera’s new book: Plan for the unplanned Invest in relationships No appeasement No toxicity Respect time Get a good night’s sleep “I think these takeaways are really very sensible advice offered to people, who may be very stressed or may not be stressed. You won’t certainly be stressed if you follow these things," he said. Glad to join the book release of ‘Live While You’re Alive’ authored by @imshivkhera .My six takeaways from the book: 1️⃣ Plan for the Unplanned.2️⃣ Invest in Relationships.3️⃣ No Appeasement.4️⃣ No Toxicity.5️⃣ Respect Time.6️⃣ Get a Good Night’s Sleep. Added my own… https://t.co/sAZbXMLh3s pic.twitter.com/iNkMBNVysI — Dr. S. Jaishankar (@DrSJaishankar) January 24, 2025 The minister also highlighted the importance of discipline in life, citing the example of young volunteers going to China’s Wuhan at the peak of the COVID-19 pandemic to get back Indians. “Most people started work from home, but the Ministry of External Affairs moved to a three-shift routine. More people came to work everyday. Instead of work from home, for us it was go home occasionally… At that time, I saw what discipline does, what a sense of duty does." “If there is personal motivation, organisational motivation, if that is the culture, people will be willing to go the extra mile and more to get things done." ‘No Risks, No Rewards’ Jaishankar stressed that there were no rewards without risks, which meant that people had to take on some stress. He cited the examples of diplomats personally overseeing the evacuation of Indian nationals from war-torn areas of Ukraine and Sudan. “We could not have got the job done if we had not taken risks," he said. Another important aspect, Jaishankar said, was being there for others at the right time, cited the examples of India delivering crucial economic aid to Sri Lanka and Covid-19 vaccines to Caribbean countries. “The aver...

title: Budget 2025: Game-Changing Schemes Or Consistent Allocation | What's In Bahi-Khata For Agri Sector?
summary: The government allocated Rs 1.52 lakh crore for the agriculture sector in the Union Budget 2024-25
full_content: Budget 2025: Game-Changing Schemes Or Consistent Allocation | What's In Bahi-Khata For Agri Sector? Curated By : Prisha Vibhavari News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 15:36 IST The government allocated Rs 1.52 lakh crore for the agriculture sector in the Union Budget 2024-25 reset Follow us on Google News In Union Budget 2024-25, the government allocated Rs 1.52 lakh crore for the agriculture sector. (Courtesy: PTI) Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to table the Union Budget 2025-26 in her traditional ‘Bahi-Khata’ on February 1 and the agriculture sector expects the government to introduce reforms which can increase productivity, rural income and enhance exports. The sector has received consistent allocations in the budget and has seen a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 5.4% from fiscal year 2019-20. related stories The outlay for the agriculture and farmers’ welfare department stands at Rs1.32 lakh crore in the current fiscal year which is slightly more than the revised budget of Rs1.27 lakh crore for fiscal year 2024. In the Union Budget 2024-25, the government allocated Rs 1.52 lakh crore to the Agriculture and Allied sectors. The government also introduced different schemes for boosting the Indian agricultural sector last year. So, the question is what game-changing reforms will the Union Budget introduce this year for the agriculture sector? Analysts Predict Budget Plan For Agricultural Sector As per the analysts, the Union Budget will most likely introduce fertiliser subsidies and welfare schemes for the agricultural sector and also introduce measures for improving the infrastructure. According to the forecast of the Bank of America Securities, there can be a marginal increase in subsidies. Meanwhile, Goldman Sachs has forecast that the expenditure of the government on rural, welfare, transfer schemes and subsidies will be around 3% of GDP. It added that some reallocation can be made in expenditure directed towards welfare spending and rural transfers. The analysts of Bank of America said that budget allocation on welfare schemes like PM Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana should see an increase and plans to upgrade roads in the rural areas should be introduced. The experts have also hinted at the introduction of measures for improving crop protection solutions and introducing agri-tech innovations. According to Reuters, two officials said that the government plans to increase expenditure on the agriculture sector by around 15%. They added that the additional cash will be directed towards, increasing storage and supply infrastructure, developing high-yielding seed varieties and improving the production of dairy products, vegetables, pulse crops and oilseeds. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The analysts are also expecting budget allocation for improving irrigation facilities, warehousing infrastructure and supply chain efficiency in the agriculture sector. tags : #UnionBudget Finance Minister Nirmala Sitaraman Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 15:36 IST News business Budget 2025: Game-Changing Schemes Or Consistent Allocation | What's In Bahi-Khata For Agri Sector? full_content: BSP Leader Harbilas Singh Rajjumajra Shot Dead in Haryana's Naraingarh Published By : News Desk PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 15:29 IST Ambala-based BSP leaders have demanded that the police should make all efforts to nab the accused at the earliest. reset Follow us on Google News BSP Leader Harbilas Singh Rajjumajra (marked in circle) with BSP chief Mayawati (Image: X/@ibram_shekar) A Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) leader from Haryana’s Ambala was shot dead by armed assailants here in Naraingarh, police said on Saturday. Police said that BSP leader Harbilas Singh Rajjumajra was accompanied by two friends, Puneet and Gugal, when the attack occurred while they were in their car on Friday evening. Puneet also sustained bullet injuries. related stories After the attack, they were rushed to PGIMER, Chandigarh where Harbilas succumbed to his injuries late at night while Puneet was stated to be out of danger. Police said the attackers have so far not been identified. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Naraingarh SHO Lalit Kumar reached the crime spot to begin investigation. Superintendent of Police, Ambala, S S Bhoria said that a police team has been constituted to nab the assailants. Ambala-based BSP leaders have demanded that the police should make all efforts to nab the accused at the earliest. Rajjumajra had unsuccessfully contested the assembly election from Naraingarh last year. title: Union Budget Leak of 1950: How Was The Country's Most Important Document Breached?
summary: 1950 Union Budget: The documents of the Union Budget had leaked from the Rashtrapati Bhavan press when they were sent for printing
full_content: Union Budget Leak of 1950: How Was The Country's Most Important Document Breached? Curated By : Prisha Vibhavari News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 14:41 IST 1950 Union Budget: The documents of the Union Budget had leaked from the Rashtrapati Bhavan press when they were sent for printing reset Follow us on Google News When the union budget was leaked in 1950, the printing of the documents took place at Rashtrapati Bhavan press on Minto Road. (Courtesy: Reuters) Union Budget History: Union Budget 2025-26 is set to be presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in the Parliament on February 1. As per the tradition, the Halwa Ceremony has taken place which marks the beginning of the lock-in period after which the budget goes for printing in the basement of the North Block in Delhi. related stories Inside the North Block’s basement is the government press along with the home ministry and the ministry of finance. However, the budget was not always printed in the North Block. So what triggered this change? The Union Budget Leak Of 1950 In 1950, one of the most unexpected things happened when the Union Budget got leaked from the Rashtrapati Bhavan press which was on Minto Road at that time. The budget used to get printed at the same press for years and its confidentiality was never breached. However, in 1950 the papers got leaked and the government decided to change the place of printing the country’s most important financial document to a more secure location. At the time of the leak, John Mathai was the finance minister of the country and he was accused of serving the interests of powerful people because of the leak. After presenting the Union Budget, the then finance minister submitted his resignation in protest against the Planning Commission. In 1980, the place where the budget gets printed once again changed and it was shifted to the current location in the North Block. What Is ‘Lock-In’ Period? The printing process of the budget was made more secure and confidential with time. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Its security was also enhanced by the strict “lock-in" period during which the officials who are working on the budget remain in isolation and have no contact with the outside world to ensure the document’s secrecy. The officials are also not allowed to use their phones and can leave only after the finance minister ends the presentation of the Union Budget in parliament. tags : Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman Union Budget Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 14:41 IST News business Union Budget Leak of 1950: How Was The Country's Most Important Document Breached? title: 95-Year-Old Geeta Devi Shares Letter Received From 'Bhai Sa' PM Modi
summary: Geeta Devi, who fondly calls PM Modi "Bhai Sa (brother)", often speaks to his photographs with folded hands, hoping for a response.
full_content: 95-Year-Old Geeta Devi Shares Letter Received From 'Bhai Sa' PM Modi Published By : News Desk IANS Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 14:35 IST Geeta Devi, who fondly calls PM Modi "Bhai Sa (brother)", often speaks to his photographs with folded hands, hoping for a response. reset Follow us on Google News Her story was shared by Modi Archives on X, along with a video. (Image: X/@modiarchive) Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s personal connection with his admirers was once again evident as he responded to 95-year-old Geeta Devi from Deoghar, Jharkhand, with a warm letter. This touching gesture followed several letters written by Geeta Devi’s grandson expressing her unwavering admiration for the Prime Minister. related stories Letters from PM | Geeta DeviShe has seen the rule of British colonial powers, the era of maharajas, and the leadership of many prime ministers in independent India, but none, in her eyes, compare to Prime Minister @narendramodi Every day, 95-year-old Geeta Devi from Rajasthan… pic.twitter.com/690MqSOmxt — Modi Archive (@modiarchive) January 25, 2025 Geeta Devi, who fondly calls PM Modi “Bhai Sa (brother)", often speaks to his photographs with folded hands, hoping for a response. Her story was shared by Modi Archives on X, along with a video. The post described her daily routine of watching PM Modi on the news and her deep respect for his leadership. “My grandmother has a keen interest in staying informed about developments and keeps track of everything new in the city," said Raman Bhardwaj, her grandson. Her son, Sanjay Bhardwaj, added, “She has witnessed the British colonial rule, the era of maharajas, and the leadership of many prime ministers, but none, in her eyes, compare to PM Modi." “There is nobody like Modiji," Geeta Devi said, elaborating that she saw many airports and hospitals being made during PM Modi’s tenure. “My blessings are with him," she added. Raman recounted how Geeta Devi became emotional when she first saw a video of PM Modi visiting Deoghar in July 2024. “She calls him her brother and hasn’t missed a single day watching him. Her dedication moved us to write letters to him," he said. PM Modi’s response brought immense joy to the family. In his letter, he wrote, “Mrs Geeta Devi ji, receiving such messages of appreciation from my beloved countrymen and women gives me immense energy to work even harder for the nation. I am delighted to hear that even at the age of 95, you stay updated on matters of the state and society. I pray for your good health and a bright future for your family." The letter has been a source of renewed energy for Geeta Devi and her family. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Her daughter-in-law, Anita Bhardwaj, shared, “Even at 95, mother has so much energy. Reading Modiji’s letter made her so happy that it has inspired us all to achieve more, no matter our age." This heartfelt exchange highlights the deep bond PM Modi shares with his supporters and the admiration he commands across generations. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - IANS ) Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 14:35 IST News india 95-Year-Old Geeta Devi Shares Letter Received From 'Bhai Sa' PM Modi Read More

title: TN Police On High Alert After Bomb Threat To Tirunelveli Railway Station Ahead Of R-Day
summary: An investigation to identify the person behind the threat is ongoing.
full_content: TN Police On High Alert After Bomb Threat To Tirunelveli Railway Station Ahead Of R-Day Published By : News Desk IANS Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 14:27 IST An investigation to identify the person behind the threat is ongoing. reset Follow us on Google News Additional security personnel were deployed to ensure the safety of passengers and staff. (PTI/Representative image) A bomb threat was issued to Tirunelveli railway station by unidentified individuals on Saturday morning, according to Daily Thanthi. Following this, local police and bomb experts have been conducting searches at the railway station since Saturday morning. related stories The unidentified individuals reportedly contacted the Chennai Police Control Room from the Gopalasamudram area in Tirunelveli. An investigation to identify the person behind the threat is ongoing. Security measures across key locations in the country have been heightened in light of the upcoming Republic Day celebrations. Authorities are conducting thorough screenings to ensure public safety. In a related development, security was also strengthened at Tuticorin Airport following a bomb threat received via email. An official from the airport stated that upon receiving the threat, police were alerted, and thorough checks were conducted with the assistance of a bomb threat assessment committee. Additional security personnel were deployed to ensure the safety of passengers and staff. The email was deemed non-specific as it did not mention a name, place, date, or time. Sniffer dogs were brought in to assist with the security sweep, and passengers are being intensively checked. So far, nothing suspicious has been found. This marks the second bomb threat alert at the airport within the last two days. As the country gears up to celebrate Republic Day on Sunday, the Greater Chennai Police have significantly increased security in the city and surrounding areas. Key locations, including Marina Beach and the routes traversed by the Governor from Raj Bhavan to the Marina, as well as the Chief Minister’s route from his residence on Chittaranjan Salai to the Marina, have been declared “Red Zones." The use of Remotely Piloted Aircraft Systems (RPAS), drones, or any other aerial objects has been banned in Chennai on January 25 and 26, except for government-sanctioned arrangements. The Republic Day celebration is scheduled to take place near the Labour Statue on Kamarajar Salai, Marina, Chennai. Under standing orders, the police have prohibited drones, remote-controlled microlight aircraft, and paragliding under Section 163 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023. The Coastal Security Group (CSG) of the Tamil Nadu Marine Police has also intensified patrolling in recent days. Security has been tightened along the coastline and mid-sea following Intelligence reports of possible smuggling of arms, drugs, and other contraband via the sea. Marine police are combing uninhabited islands in the Gulf of Mannar and inspecting fishing boats operating in deep-sea and coastal areas. Several police companies have been deployed for security arrangements in all district capitals of Tamil Nadu, as well as in Chennai, starting January 24. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Security agencies are leaving no stone unturned to ensure the smooth conduct of the grand event. Recent confrontations between the Governor and the DMK government, with the Governor taking certain contentious positions on Tamil Nadu’s governance, have raised concerns among Intelligence agencies. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - IANS ) Location : Chennai, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 14:27 IST News india TN Police On High Alert After Bomb Threat To Tirunelveli Railway Station Ahead Of R-Day Read More

title: Republic Day Parade 2025: Know About Guests And Schedule; Check Where to Watch LIVE
summary: Republic Day Parade: The parade in the national capital will commence at 10:30 AM at Vijay Chowk, on Sunday.
full_content: Republic Day Parade 2025: Know About Guests And Schedule; Check Where to Watch LIVE Curated By : News Desk News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 14:15 IST Republic Day Parade: The parade in the national capital will commence at 10:30 AM at Vijay Chowk, on Sunday. reset Follow us on Google News The parade's theme revolves around “Swarnim Bharat: Virasat aur Vikas” (Golden India: Heritage and Development) (PTI photo) As the country gears up to celebrate the 76th Republic Day on Monday, January 26, the stage is all set for the grand event. The Republic Day commemorates the adoption of the Constitution of India on 26 January, 1950. The Constitution of India came into effect in 1950, three years after the country became free from British rule in 1947. With the adoption of the Constitution, India declared itself a sovereign, democratic, and republican state. related stories In a press release, Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) mentioned that this year’s Republic Day Parade will be a unique blend of India’s cultural diversity and military prowess, highlighting the 75 years of enacting the Constitution and Jan Bhagidari (people partnership). The Republic Day Parade will begin in the morning, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi laying a wreath at the National War Memorial in the national capital. While President Droupadi Murmu will arrive at Kartavya Path in a ceremonial buggy and receive the salute during a ceremonial march past, involving units from the Armed Forces, Para Military Forces, Auxiliary Civil Forces, NCC, and NSS. In all, 18 marching contingents, 15 Bands and 31 tableaux are expected to take part in the parade. Here are the details of 76th Republic Day parade: 76th Republic Day: Parade Timings And Schedule The parade in the national capital will commence at 10:30 AM on Sunday at Vijay Chowk. It will proceed along Kartavya Path and conclude at the Red Fort after passiing via India Gate. The grand event will conclude with a flypast by 47 aircraft, displaying India’s spectacular aerial capabilities. When And Where To Watch 76th Republic Day Parade LIVE The Republic Day celebrations will be broadcasted and streamed online for those who can’t attend the event in-person. Those tuning in from their TV sets can catch the live telecast of the parade on Doordarshan, the official broadcaster. The event coverage begins at around 9:00 AM with the flag-hoisting ceremony by the President of India. Online viewers can watch the live event on Doordarshan National’s official YouTube channel. Besides, Prasar Bharati Live, the official government broadcast site, Disney+ Hotstar and other private news channels will also stream the Republic Day event on their websites and apps. Those willing to Republic Day parade in person will require to purchase tickets online on the Ministry of Defence’s Amantran Portal or offline at designated counters. Who Is The Chief Guest For Republic Day Parade This Year? Prabowo Subianto, President of the Republic of Indonesia, is the Chief Guest at the Republic Day parade in 2025. To attend the ceremonial event, 10,000 special guests have been invited from the entire country who will sit on the two sides of the Kartavya Path and witness the Republic Day parade which will span from Rashtrapati Bhavan to India Gate. Theme Of 76th Republic Day Parade The parade’s theme revolves around “Swarnim Bharat: Virasat aur Vikas" (Golden India: Heritage and Development), celebrating 75 years since the enactment of the Indian Constitution. The tableaux from 15 states and union territories will cover Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Chandigarh, Goa, Gujarat, Haryana, Jharkhand, Karnataka, and Madhya Pradesh. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Nearly 300 cultural artists will display their talent in the parade. For the first time, 5000 folk and tribal artists will perform on the entire stretch of Kartavya Path. More than 45 tribal and folk arts, including Indonesian art, will also be showcased. Location : Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 14:11 IST News india Republic Day Parade 2025: Know About Guests And Schedule; Check Where to Watch LIVE Read More

title: Explained: Who Is Tahawwur Rana? What Was His Role In The 26/11 Attacks?
summary: The US approved the extradition of 26/11 convict Tahawwur Rana to India. Rana, who aided David Headley, had his last appeal dismissed. Mumbai Police filed charges against Rana in 2023.
full_content: Explained: Who Is Tahawwur Rana? What Was His Role In The 26/11 Attacks? Reported By : Siddhant Mishra News18.com Edited By: Pragati Ratti Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 16:51 IST The US approved the extradition of 26/11 convict Tahawwur Rana to India. Rana, who aided David Headley, had his last appeal dismissed. Mumbai Police filed charges against Rana in 2023. reset Follow us on Google News Tahawwur Rana has unsuccessfully appealed his extradition in lower courts, including the US court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit in San Francisco. (Image: PTI) The United States has cleared 26/11 Mumbai attacks convict Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India. A US court dismissed a review petition against his conviction in the case, crushing Rana’s last legal chance to avoid being extradited to India. Who is Tahawwur Rana? related stories Tahawwur Hussain Rana, was tried in a US District Court on charges related to his support for a terrorist organisation that carried out the Mumbai attacks and another terror conspiracy in Denmark. The US Supreme Court on Saturday approved the extradition of Tahawwur Rana to India. The writ petition which was filed in November last year was denied by the Supreme Court a day after Donald Trump assumed the role of US President. Rana has unsuccessfully appealed his extradition in lower courts, including the US court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit in San Francisco. In August, the Ninth Circuit ruled that the India-US Extradition Treaty allows Rana’s extradition. Mumbai Police Filed Supplementary Chargesheet In 2023 A 400-page supplementary chargesheet was filed by Mumbai Police against Tahawwur Rana in 2023.This was the fourth chargesheet in the 26/11 case. This chargesheet was filed ‘defining’ Rana’s role in the attacks. This came after India sought his extradition in 2020. In this chargesheet, the Mumbai Police said Rana stayed in a Mumbai Hotel for two days in Nov 2008 ahead of attack. Rana helped David Headley to get an Indian Tourist Visa with the help for fake documents, the chargesheet said. The crime branch has found email communications between Headley and Rana in which they talked about Major Iqbal of ISI who was also a co-conspirator of the 26/11 attacks. Also Read: ‘Big Win For India’, Says 26/11 Prosecutor Ujjwal Nikam As US Prepares To Send Tahawwur Rana To India Chronology of India’s Request for Rana’s Extradition On December 4, 2019, India submitted a diplomatic note to the US to extradite Rana. On June 10, 2020, India filed a complaint seeking the provisional arrest of Rana with a view towards extradition. The Joe Biden administration in the US supported Rana’s extradition to India. In October 2009, the US Law Enforcement had arrested David Headley in Chicago. Headley pledged guilty to 12 terrorism related charges in the Northern District Illinois including multiple counts related to the Mumbai attacks and the foiled Denmark plot. Headley agreed to co-operate with the US and his plea agreement contained a non extradition provision. Rana was inducted in October 2009. He was convicted for providing logistical support for a foiled attack in Denmark but was acquitted for terrorism activities in India. The district court sentenced Rana to 14 years imprisonment. Headley testified against Rana in court. While he was in custody, in August 2018, an Indian court issued a warrant for Rana’s arrest. Rana sought compassionate release during Convid-19. One day after Rana was granted compassionate release, the United States filed a complaint for his provisional arrest in response to India’s extradition request On what grounds did Rana oppose his extradition? Rana fought against his extradition mainly on two grounds – one that his extradition is barred under the Non Bis Idem Provision in Extradition Treaty, which means he can’t be tried for same offence twice and second, that he cannot be extradited under the offence for which he was acquitted in the requested country (US). How was Rana linked to Headley As per the US court documents accessed by CNN-News18, Rana and David Coleman Headley were childhood friends. In adulthood, Rana deserted his post in the Pakistan Army and moved to Chicago where he established an immigration business. According to Headley’s testimony, they both met in Chicago multiple times over the course of three years plotting to assist Lashkar in the Mumbai terror attack. In August 2005, the pair met over several days in Chicago, where Headley told Rana about Lashkar’s plans for him to travel to public places and government facilities in India to conduct surveillance for a possible attack. Headley proposed using Rana’s immigration business as a front for Lashkar’s surveillance activities, with Headley posing as an “immigration consultant" for Rana in Mumbai. To sweeten the deal for Rana, Headley offered to help resolve Rana’s status as a deserter from the Pakistani army. In June 2006, Headley again met with Rana in Chicago, elaborating on his involvement with Lashkar...

title: Retired Officer To See Son Command Navy Contingent Like He Did 34 Years Ago At Republic Day Parade
summary: Lt Cdr Saahil Ahluwalia will lead the Navy contingent at Republic Day, 34 years after his father, Cmde (Retired) Ravi Ahluwalia. Saahil is the Gunnery Officer on INS Mysore.
full_content: Retired Officer To See Son Command Navy Contingent Like He Did 34 Years Ago At Republic Day Parade Reported By : Kamalika Sengupta News18.com Edited By: Pragati Ratti Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 13:27 IST Lt Cdr Saahil Ahluwalia will lead the Navy contingent at Republic Day, 34 years after his father, Cmde (Retired) Ravi Ahluwalia. Saahil is the Gunnery Officer on INS Mysore. reset Follow us on Google News As a Gunner, Lt Cmdr Saahil Ahluwalia has now been given the opportunity to lead the Indian Navy contingent at Kartavya Path. (Image: Indian Navy) It’s going to be a special moment for Lt Cdr Saahil Ahluwalia, Contingent Commander of the Navy this year at the Republic Day 2025 parade, as 34 years ago his father was Contingent Commander of the Navy. Retired Cmde Ravi Ahluwalia will go with his family to see his son leading the contingent at Kartavya Path. The entire family has been ecstatic and is eagerly waiting for the moment. Lt Cdr Saahil Ahluwalia is a second-generation Naval officer, having joined the INA in December 2012. He was adjudged the best sportsperson of the course at the academy. He was commissioned in November 2016 and has served on frontline warships Teg, Kolkata, Tabar and Kirch, where he was deployed for anti-piracy patrol, operations deployments and Samudra Setu (Covid). During various overseas deployments on board naval ships, he has visited about 27 countries and exercised with numerous foreign navies. related stories A gunnery and missile warfare specialist, he is presently posted on board INS Mysore as Gunnery Officer. He was selected twice as Guard Officer to the Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces, The President of India. As a gunner, he has now been given the opportunity to lead the Indian Navy contingent at Kartavya Path in New Delhi. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Speaking to News 18, Lt Cdr Sahil Ahluwalia said, “ It would be a moment of immense pride and honour for me as a second-generation naval officer to follow in my father’s footsteps. It is the culmination of months of relentless hard work, discipline, and teamwork, with every member of the contingent striving for perfection both on the parade ground and behind the scenes. We are very confident that we will win the best marching contingent trophy this year. " Speaking to News18, retired Cmde Ravi Ahluwalia (Retired) said, “I am very happy to see that my son will do the same which I did 34 years ago. The hard work put in by the complete contingent will be visible on the Kartavya Path. My best wishes to all these young boys and girls who have chosen the noble profession of the Navy to serve the country." tags : republic day 2025 republic day parade Location : Kolkata, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 13:27 IST News india Retired Officer To See Son Command Navy Contingent Like He Did 34 Years Ago At Republic Day Parade Read More

title: PM Modi Interacts With R-Day Participants: 'Soldiers, Youngsters Inspire Me To Work Hard'
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi enjoyed the cultural performances of the participants of the Republic Day and applauded them
full_content: PM Modi Interacts With R-Day Participants: 'Soldiers, Youngsters Inspire Me To Work Hard' Curated By : Prisha Vibhavari News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 13:37 IST Prime Minister Narendra Modi enjoyed the cultural performances of the participants of the Republic Day and applauded them reset Follow us on Google News Prime Minister Narendra Modi interacts with Republic Day parade participants. (Courtesy: ANI) Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday interacted with NCC cadets, NSS volunteers, Rashtriya Rangshala camp artists, tribal guests and tableaux artists who will participate in the Republic Day parade on January 26. During the interaction, NCC cadets sang songs like “Padharo Mare Desh" and “Saare Jahan Se Accha" for the prime minister. related stories #WATCH | Delhi: Prime Minister Narendra Modi yesterday interacted with NCC cadets, NSS volunteers, Rashtriya Rangshala camp artists, tribal guests and tableaux artists who would be a part of the upcoming #RepublicDay parade(Video: DD) pic.twitter.com/ecjGTj860z — ANI (@ANI) January 25, 2025 PM Modi also watched the cultural and dance performances of the participants. The prime minister was seen applauding the participants as they showcased their talent. Speaking about his source of inspiration and strength, PM Modi said, “When I meet youngsters like you, I get energy. When I see all of you, I get inspiration. Sometimes when I remember the farmers of the country, I feel how many hours they work, when I remember the soldiers of the country, I feel how many hours they stand at the border, everyone does it and works very hard." #WATCH | Delhi: When asked where he gets inspiration and strength from, Prime Minister Narendra Modi says, “This is a very difficult question. When I meet youngsters like you, I get energy. When I see all of you, I get inspiration. Sometimes when I remember the farmers of the… pic.twitter.com/ZIz732b2Vh — ANI (@ANI) January 25, 2025 India Gears Up To Celebrate Its 76th Republic Day India is gearing up to celebrate its 76th Republic Day on January 26, 2025, with all pomp and show and mark it as an achievement of a major milestone since the first Republic Day which was celebrated in 1950. To attend the ceremonial event, 10,000 special guests have been invited from the entire country who will sit on the two sides of the Kartavya Path and witness the Republic Day parade which will span from Rashtrapati Bhavan to India Gate. The parade will showcase contingents from the Indian Armed Forces and paramilitary forces. In all, 18 marching contingents, 15 Bands and 31 tableaux are expected to take part in the parade. The tableaux from 15 states and union territories will cover Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Chandigarh, Goa, Gujarat, Haryana, Jharkhand, Karnataka, and Madhya Pradesh. Nearly 300 cultural artists will display their talent in the parade. For the first time, 5000 folk and tribal artists will perform on the entire stretch of Kartavya Path. More than 45 tribal and folk arts, including Indonesian art, will also be showcased. The Republic Day parade will start on January 26 at 10:30 am. In total, 7,70,00 people have been given passes and tickets out of which 32,000 are ticket holders and 10,000 are special invitees. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Every year, the government selects a theme for the Republic Day celebration and this year’s theme is ‘Swarnim Bharat: Virasat aur Vikas’ (Golden India: Heritage and Progress). On January 26, the country became a democratic republic and the first Republic Day was celebrated. This year will mark the completion of 75 years since the country adopted its Constitution. tags : Narendra Modi republic day Location : New Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 13:23 IST News india PM Modi Interacts With R-Day Participants: 'Soldiers, Youngsters Inspire Me To Work Hard' Read More

title: News18 Afternoon Digest: 26/11 prosecutor Nikam's reaction, Saif's Sample Collection, Guillain-Barre Syndrome And Other Top Stories
summary: News18 Afternoon Digest: We are covering 26/11 prosecutor Ujjwal Nikam's reaction, Saif Ali Khan's blood sample collection, Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS) and other top stories.

title: Saif Ali Khan Stabbing Case: Mumbai Police Collect Actor's Blood Sample And Clothes
summary: Saif Ali Khan's blood sample and clothes of both the actor and attacker have been sent to the Forensic Lab
full_content: Saif Ali Khan Stabbing Case: Mumbai Police Collect Actor's Blood Sample And Clothes Curated By : Prisha Vibhavari News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 12:35 IST Saif Ali Khan's blood sample and clothes of both the actor and attacker have been sent to the Forensic Lab reset Follow us on Google News The blood stains on the clothes of the attacker will be matched by Saif Ali Khan's blood sample by the Forensic Lab (FSL). Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan’s blood sample and clothes which he was wearing on the night of the knife attack were collected by the Mumbai Police as part of the investigation. As per the remand copy of the accused, the clothes which the actor was wearing when he was attacked by the intruder have been taken into police custody for carrying out the investigation. related stories The police have also found blood stains on the clothes which were worn by the accused attacker Shariful Islam on the night when the incident occurred. The police have collected the blood samples of Khan to match with those stains. The police have sent the actor’s clothes and blood samples and the clothes of the attacker to the Forensic Lab (FSL) to check if the blood stains on the clothes of the attacker are of the actor. Police Custody Of Accused Extended Till Jan 29 The police custody of the accused was extended till January 29 by the Bandra Magistrate Court on Friday. The court stated that the matter has seen substantial progress and it is necessary to investigate other consequential aspects. Mumbai Police had appealed for an extension of the custody of the accused and have expressed their suspicion of more accomplices being involved in the stabbing case. Last week, Khan was stabbed multiple times by an intruder who had barged into his house with the intent of robbery. The police later arrested Mohd Shariful Islam Shehzad as the accused in the case. The actor had sustained stab wounds in the spine and other areas and was rushed to Lilavati Hospital immediately where he underwent multiple surgeries. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Mumbai Police on Wednesday collected several fingerprints of the accused from the residence of the actor in Bandra. The fingerprints were also collected from the stairs of the building, the door handle of Jeh’s room and the door of the toilet. As per the police officials, the accused had tried to break into three houses before he entered Saif’s residence. tags : Actor Saif Ali Khan mumbai police stabbing attack Location : Mumbai, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 12:24 IST News india Saif Ali Khan Stabbing Case: Mumbai Police Collect Actor's Blood Sample And Clothes Read More

title: From Vijay Mallya To Nirav Modi, A Look At Fugitives India Wants To Extradite
summary: Tahawwur Rana Extradition: India is trying to bring back several other offenders who had turned fugitives. Here's a look at 5 key extradition battles being fought by India abroad.
full_content: From Vijay Mallya To Nirav Modi, A Look At Fugitives India Wants To Extradite Curated By : Mallika Soni News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 12:02 IST Tahawwur Rana Extradition: India is trying to bring back several other offenders who had turned fugitives. Here's a look at 5 key extradition battles being fought by India abroad. reset Follow us on Google News Tahawwur Rana Extradition: Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi are seen. The US Supreme Court cleared the path for the extradition of Tahawwur Rana, a Pakistani-Canadian national, to India, marking an end to his legal options in avoiding extradition. The top court approved Tahawwur Rana’s extradition as it dismissed the terror convict’s review request against his conviction. Other than Tahawwur Rana, India is trying to bring back several other offenders who had turned fugitives. Here’s a look at 5 key extradition battles being fought by India abroad: Tahawwur Hussain Rana related stories Tahawwur Rana, a Pakistani-origin Canadian businessman, is wanted for his role in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks. He is a former military doctor who served in the Pakistan Army and was arrested in 2009 for a terror plot in Denmark. He has also been convicted of helping Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) with material support. Arsh Dalla Khalistani terrorist Arshdeep Singh Gill alia Arsh Dalla, de-facto leader of banned outfit Khalistan Tiger Force, is based in Canada and is wanted in India in over 50 cases of murder, attempt to murder, extortion, and terrorist acts. He was designated a “terrorist" in January, 2004. Anmol Bishnoi Anmol Bishnoi- younger brother of Lawrence Bishnoi- is wanted in India for several high-profile cases, including murders of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala and politician Baba Siddique. He was arrested in the US last November for entering the country without valid documents. Vijay Mallya Vijay Mallya faces a loan default case of over Rs 9,000 crore and left India in 2016. He is currently in the UK and is wanted in India for fraud after the collapse of his company Kingfisher Airlines. He was declared a fugitive in 2019. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Nirav Modi Diamantaire Nirav Modi and his uncle Mehul Choksi- key accused in the Rs 14,000 crore PNB loan fraud case- left India in 2018 and was arrested in London the same year. Nirav Modi has lost all his petitions against extradition to India so far and Mehul Choksi is now in Antigua. Location : Delhi, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 12:02 IST News india From Vijay Mallya To Nirav Modi, A Look At Fugitives India Wants To Extradite Read More

title: Medical Alert In J&K's Rajouri: Doctors’ Leaves Cancelled Amid Deaths Due Mysterious Illness
summary: The number of people sent to quarantine has risen to 230.
full_content: Medical Alert In J&K's Rajouri: Doctors’ Leaves Cancelled Amid Deaths Due Mysterious Illness Published By : News Desk PTI Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 11:37 IST The number of people sent to quarantine has risen to 230. reset Follow us on Google News The remote Badhaal village was declared a containment zone on Wednesday (PTI file photo) Authorities have cancelled all leaves of doctors and paramedics in the wake of a medical alert following the deaths of 17 people from Badhaal village in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri district due to a mysterious illness . The number of people sent to quarantine has risen to 230. related stories Union minister Dr Jitendra Singh said the initial investigation conducted by the toxicology laboratory in Lucknow concluded that the cause was not any infection, virus or bacteria but a toxin. Principal of Rajouri Government Medical College (GMC) Hospital, Dr Amarjeet Singh Bhatia, on Friday addressed a press conference in Rajouri and announced that all leaves of doctors and paramedic staff have been cancelled. “The winter vacations have also been cancelled to deal with the medical alert situation after 17 people from three families died under mysterious conditions in the last one-and-a-half months," he said. He further said the Jammu and Kashmir government has deputed 10 additional medical students to GMC Rajouri to aid the medical setup amid the ongoing health situation. The health condition of three persons undergoing treatment at GMC Hospital in Jammu and PGI Chandigarh is being monitored, officials said. Four people, including three sisters, were shifted to hospitals, with three airlifted to a hospital in Jammu on Wednesday. More persons, including relatives who had come in contact with the victim families, were sent on Friday to quarantine as a precautionary measure. As a precaution, more individuals, including close relatives of the deceased, have been relocated to the Nursing College quarantine centre in Rajouri, increasing the number to 230, the officials said. Strict security has been put in place at the Nursing College quarantine centre in Rajouri, which has been heavily secured and fenced, they added. Several people who came into contact with the affected families, from taking children to the hospital to burying them, have also been identified, they said. The Union minister said a thorough investigation is underway. “The initial investigation conducted by our toxicology laboratory in Lucknow concluded that it was not due to any infection, virus or bacteria but rather a toxin," he said. He added that the investigation into the nature of the toxin is going on. “There is a long series of toxins being tested. I believe a solution will be found soon. Additionally, if there was any mischief or malicious activity, that is also being investigated," he said. The remote Badhaal village was declared a containment zone on Wednesday, with prohibitory orders imposed on all public and private gatherings in the wake of the deaths, the officials said. Seventeen people, including 13 children, from the families of Mohammad Fazal, Mohammad Aslam and Mohammad Rafiq in Badhaal village died due to a mysterious illness over the past one-and-a-half months. Both the central team and police are continuing their separate probes into the deaths, they said. A central team continued its investigation on Friday into the cause of the deaths which occurred in three families. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all The Special Investigation Team (SIT), which was set up by the police after certain neurotoxins were found in the samples of the deceased, continued its probe into the criminal angle. They have questioned over 50 people in this case, the officials said. Dr Bhatia revealed that the common factor among all 17 deaths is the involvement of the brain and damage to the nervous system. (This story has not been edited by News18 staff and is published from a syndicated news agency feed - PTI ) tags : jammu & kashmir rajouri Location : Rajouri, India First Published: January 25, 2025, 11:25 IST News india Medical Alert In J&K's Rajouri: Doctors’ Leaves Cancelled Amid Deaths Due Mysterious Illness Read More

title: Odisha Girl Falls Off Train While Clicking Selfie, Dies
summary: It is learnt that Behera recently topped in computer science at a private university.
full_content: Odisha Girl Falls Off Train While Clicking Selfie, Dies Curated By : Manisha Roy News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 11:00 IST It is learnt that Behera recently topped in computer science at a private university. reset Follow us on Google News A trackman noticed the girl falling off the train and alerted the Tangiriapal station authorities. (Representative image) In a tragic incident in Odisha, a 20-year-old woman died while allegedly clicking a selfie after falling off a train she was travelling on, in Keonjhar district. The deceased has been identified as Namrata Behera, a resident of Dalang village under Khireitangiri gram panchayat in the district, according to a report in Times of India. related stories The mishap was reported when Namrata, along with her four friends, was travelling on the Puri-Barbil Express. A trackman noticed the girl falling off the train and alerted the Tangiriapal station authorities. Soon after the information was received, railway and Harichandanpur police rushed to the spot. They recovered the body and sent it for post-mortem. The report, citing sources, suggested that she recently topped in computer science at a private university. The deceased’s father, Bijayananda Behera, is a vegetable vendor, and her mother a homemaker. “We are verifying the cause of the incident," TOI quoted Sushanta Sethy, SI of railway police, Jajpur-Keonjhar Road, as saying. More details are awaited. With Earphones Plugged In, Girl Crossing Tracks Run Over By Train top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all In a separate incident, a 16-year-old girl was run over by a train in Maharashtra on Thursday. The deceased, identified as Vaishnavi Rawal, was a resident of Makane village in Palghar district. The girl was crossing the tracks at Saphale Railway Station when the tragedy unfolded. The girl had allegedly plugged in earphones at the time and she did not hear the approaching express train’s horn and was fatally struck. Her death caused panic area, leading to gathering of people near the track. tags : Odisha selfie Location : Odisha (Orissa), India First Published: January 25, 2025, 10:49 IST News india Odisha Girl Falls Off Train While Clicking Selfie, Dies Read More

title: Autos And Taxis In Mumbai Will Cost You More From February 1: Check New Fares
summary: Mumbai Auto And Taxi Price Hike: The new fares can be charged only after meters are recalibrated, the MMRTA noted.
full_content: Autos And Taxis In Mumbai Will Cost You More From February 1: Check New Fares Curated By : Mallika Soni News18.com Last Updated: January 25, 2025, 10:40 IST Mumbai Auto And Taxi Price Hike: The new fares can be charged only after meters are recalibrated, the MMRTA noted. reset Follow us on Google News Mumbai Auto And Taxi Price Hike: Following the hike, passengers using auto rickshaws will be paying Rs 26 instead of Rs 23. The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Transport Authority (MMRTA) approved a hike of Rs 3 in the basic fare of auto rickshaws and black-and-yellow taxis from February 1 in Mumbai. The last fare hike for autos and taxis took place in October 2022. How much will autos and taxis cost you in Mumbai From February 1 related stories Following the hike, passengers using auto rickshaws will be paying Rs 26 instead of Rs 23, passengers using taxis will need to pay Rs 31 from the current Rs 28 and the fare for blue-and-silver AC cool cabs will be at Rs 48- a hike from Rs 40 for the first 1.5 kilometres. The new fares can be charged only after meters are recalibrated, the MMRTA noted. “The fares are being reduced due to competition from BEST and Navi Mumbai municipal transport, whose minimum AC bus fares are Rs 6 and Rs 10, respectively," a transport department official said. top videos View all Swipe Left For Next Video View all Moreover, the transport department has also said that seven new auto stands may be built outside five Metro 3 stations to improve last-mile connectivity for the first phase of the Metro 3 line which runs from Aarey to Bandra-Kurla Complex. The MMRTA also said that it will introduce over 30 regular and share auto-taxi stands along busy routes in eastern and western suburbs, as well as in Thane, Kalyan and Vasai. title: Republic Day 2025: Traffic Advisory Issued In Delhi-NCR. Check Out Diversions, Roads To Avoid
summary: The traffic police have issued advisories in Delhi, Noida and Gurugram to avoid congestion during the Republic Day parade in the national capital on Sunday.
full_content: Republic Day 2025: Traffic Advisory Issued In Delhi-NCR. Check Out Diversions, Roads To Avoid Curated By : Prisha Vibhavari News18.com Last Updated: January 26, 2025, 07:51 IST The traffic police have issued advisories in Delhi, Noida and Gurugram to avoid congestion during the Republic Day parade in the national capital on Sunday. reset Follow us on Google News The Republic Day parade will begin at 10:30 am on Kartavya Path and move towards the Red Fort. As India celebrates its 76th Republic Day on Sunday, traffic advisories were issued by the authorities for the commuters in Delhi, Noida, and Gurugram to avoid congestion as they step out of their homes during the Republic Day parade on Kartavya Path . The authorities have appealed to the people to adhere to the guidelines to avoid disruptions and delays on the occasion. related stories Roads Which Will Remain Closed In Delhi According to the advisory, the programme will start at the National War Memorial, India Gate at 9.30 am after which the Republic Day parade will begin at 10:30 am and move towards the Red Fort. The route of the parade will be Vijay Chowk, Kartavya Path, C-Hexagon, statue of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, Tilak Marg, Bahadur Shah Zafar (BSZ) Marg, Netaji Subhash Marg, and Red Fort. On Republic Day eve, vehicles are not being permitted from 5 pm on Kartavya Path from Vijay Chowk to India Gate till the parade is over on January 26. On Kartavya Path, including Rafi Marg, Janpath, and Man Singh Road, no cross-traffic is being allowed from 10 pm on Saturday till the official celebrations conclude today. On January 26, the C-Hexagon-India Gate area will be closed from 9:15 am till the parade crosses Tilak Marg. According to the traffic police, vehicles on Tilak Marg, BSZ Marg and Subhash Marg will not be permitted in both directions from 10:30 am while cross-traffic will be allowed depending on the movement of the parade. “On January 26, Delhi Chief Minister Atishi will host the National Flag at Chhatrasal Stadium, with ministers, MLAs, and senior officials attending," stated the advisory. The commuters have been asked to avoid these roads and opt for alternate routers on January 26. Delhi Metro, Taxis For January 26 As per the advisory, the Delhi Metro will be available at all stations for the commuters. In areas around Mother Teresa Crescent, Baba Kharak Singh Marg, Ashoka Road up to roundabout Patel Chowk, Sansad Marg, Kasturba Gandhi Marg up to Ferozshah Road, Ferozshah Road up to roundabout Mandi House, Bhagwan Dass Road, Mathura Road, Subramanian Bharti Marg, Humayun Road, APJ Abdul Kalam Marg, Kemal Ataturk Marg, and Kautilya Marg, no auto-rickshaws and taxis will be allowed to enter from 7 am on Sunday. Meanwhile, the city buses will not ply at Park Street/Udyan Marg, Aram Bagh Road (Paharganj), Kamla Market roundabout, Delhi Secretariat (Indira Gandhi Stadium), Pragati Maidan (Bhairon Road), Hanuman Mandir (Yamuna Bazar), Mori Gate, ISBT-Kashmiri Gate, ISBT-Sarai Kale Khan and Tis Hazari Court. Diversions And Alternative Routes In Delhi The buses coming from Shivaji Stadium have been asked to change their route and take National Highway-24, Ring Road, and end their journey at Bhairon Road. Meanwhile, those coming from National Highway-24 will head to Road No. 56. They will terminate at ISBT-Anand Vihar. The routes of buses coming from Ghaziabad have been diverted at Mohan Nagar and they will move towards Bhopra Chungi for Wazirabad Bridge. Traffic AdvisoryIn view of @republicday2025 Celebrations on January 26, 2025, certain traffic restrictions will be effective in Delhi. Commuters are requested to avoid the mentioned routes and plan their journey accordingly. #DPTrafficAdvisory pic.twitter.com/g6wWtnxf2z — Delhi Traffic Police (@dtptraffic) January 24, 2025 The Delhi Traffic Police has shared the alternative routers for the commuters. Commuters have been asked to use the Ring Road via Ashram Chowk, Sarai Kale Khan, I.P. Flyover, and Rajghat in the North-South corridor. Travellers were advised to take either of the two alternative routes in the East-West corridor. These are the routes: Ring Road-Bhairon Road-Mathura Road-Subramaniam Bharti Marg-Rajesh Pilot Marg-Prithvi Raj Road-Safdarjung Road-Kamal Ataturk Marg-Panchsheel Marg-Simon Boliver Marg-Upper Ridge Road/Vande Matram Marg. Ring Road-ISBT-Chandgi Ram Akhara-Mall Road-Azad Pur-Ring Road. Ring Road-Bhairon Road-Mathura Road-Lodhi Road-Aurobindo Road-Safdarjung Road-Teen Murti Marg-Mother Teresa Crescent-Park Street-Shankar Road-Vande Matram Marg. Traffic Advisory In Gurugram The traffic police have imposed restrictions on medium and heavy goods vehicles in Gurugram. Vehicles are not allowed to enter the city from 5 pm on January 25 until 1:30 pm on January 26. “Heavy vehicles will be diverted at various checkpoints, including Pachgaon on the KMP Expressway and Hero Honda Chowk," said DCP (Traffic) Virender Vij.
